00097 /*!
00098  * \brief Structure representing a RTP session.
00099  *
00100  * RTP session is defined on page 9 of RFC 3550: "An association among a set of participants communicating with RTP.  A participant may be involved in multiple RTP sessions at the same time [...]"
00101  *
00102  */
00103 /*! \brief The value of each payload format mapping: */
00104 struct rtpPayloadType {
00105    int isAstFormat;  /*!< whether the following code is an AST_FORMAT */
00106    int code;
00107 };

00110 /*! \brief RTP session description */
00111 struct ast_rtp {
00112    int s;
00113    struct ast_frame f;
00114    unsigned char rawdata[8192 + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET];
00115    unsigned int ssrc;      /*!< Synchronization source, RFC 3550, page 10. */
00116    unsigned int themssrc;     /*!< Their SSRC */
00117    unsigned int rxssrc;
00118    unsigned int lastts;
00119    unsigned int lastrxts;
00120    unsigned int lastividtimestamp;
00121    unsigned int lastovidtimestamp;
00122    unsigned int lastitexttimestamp;
00123    unsigned int lastotexttimestamp;
00124    unsigned int lasteventseqn;
00125    int lastrxseqno;                /*!< Last received sequence number */
00126    unsigned short seedrxseqno;     /*!< What sequence number did they start with?*/
00127    unsigned int seedrxts;          /*!< What RTP timestamp did they start with? */
00128    unsigned int rxcount;           /*!< How many packets have we received? */
00129    unsigned int rxoctetcount;      /*!< How many octets have we received? should be rxcount *160*/
00130    unsigned int txcount;           /*!< How many packets have we sent? */
00131    unsigned int txoctetcount;      /*!< How many octets have we sent? (txcount*160)*/
00132    unsigned int cycles;            /*!< Shifted count of sequence number cycles */
00133    double rxjitter;                /*!< Interarrival jitter at the moment */
00134    double rxtransit;               /*!< Relative transit time for previous packet */
00135    int lasttxformat;
00136    int lastrxformat;
00137 
00138    int rtptimeout;         /*!< RTP timeout time (negative or zero means disabled, negative value means temporarily disabled) */
00139    int rtpholdtimeout;     /*!< RTP timeout when on hold (negative or zero means disabled, negative value means temporarily disabled). */
00140    int rtpkeepalive;    /*!< Send RTP comfort noice packets for keepalive */
00141 
00142    /* DTMF Reception Variables */
00143    char resp;
00144    unsigned int lastevent;
00145    int dtmfcount;
00146    unsigned int dtmfsamples;
00147    /* DTMF Transmission Variables */
00148    unsigned int lastdigitts;
00149    char sending_digit;  /*!< boolean - are we sending digits */
00150    char send_digit;  /*!< digit we are sending */
00151    int send_payload;
00152    int send_duration;
00153    int nat;
00154    unsigned int flags;
00155    struct sockaddr_in us;     /*!< Socket representation of the local endpoint. */
00156    struct sockaddr_in them;   /*!< Socket representation of the remote endpoint. */
00157    struct timeval rxcore;
00158    struct timeval txcore;
00159    double drxcore;                 /*!< The double representation of the first received packet */
00160    struct timeval lastrx;          /*!< timeval when we last received a packet */
00161    struct timeval dtmfmute;
00162    struct ast_smoother *smoother;
00163    int *ioid;
00164    unsigned short seqno;      /*!< Sequence number, RFC 3550, page 13. */
00165    unsigned short rxseqno;
00166    struct sched_context *sched;
00167    struct io_context *io;
00168    void *data;
00169    ast_rtp_callback callback;
00170 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE
00171    ast_mutex_t bridge_lock;
00172 #endif
00173    struct rtpPayloadType current_RTP_PT[MAX_RTP_PT];
00174    int rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat; /*!< a cache for the result of rtp_lookup_code(): */
00175    int rtp_lookup_code_cache_code;
00176    int rtp_lookup_code_cache_result;
00177    struct ast_rtcp *rtcp;
00178    struct ast_codec_pref pref;
00179    struct ast_rtp *bridged;        /*!< Who we are Packet bridged to */
00180 };

00192 #define FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE       (3 << 1)
00193 #define FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE     (0 << 1)
00194 #define FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE_NOWARN (1 << 1)

00202 /*!
00203  * \brief Structure defining an RTCP session.
00204  * 
00205  * The concept "RTCP session" is not defined in RFC 3550, but since 
00206  * this structure is analogous to ast_rtp, which tracks a RTP session, 
00207  * it is logical to think of this as a RTCP session.
00208  *
00209  * RTCP packet is defined on page 9 of RFC 3550.
00210  * 
00211  */
00212 struct ast_rtcp {
00213    int s;            /*!< Socket */
00214    struct sockaddr_in us;     /*!< Socket representation of the local endpoint. */
00215    struct sockaddr_in them;   /*!< Socket representation of the remote endpoint. */
00216    unsigned int soc;    /*!< What they told us */
00217    unsigned int spc;    /*!< What they told us */
00218    unsigned int themrxlsr;    /*!< The middle 32 bits of the NTP timestamp in the last received SR*/
00219    struct timeval rxlsr;      /*!< Time when we got their last SR */
00220    struct timeval txlsr;      /*!< Time when we sent or last SR*/
00221    unsigned int expected_prior;  /*!< no. packets in previous interval */
00222    unsigned int received_prior;  /*!< no. packets received in previous interval */
00223    int schedid;         /*!< Schedid returned from ast_sched_add() to schedule RTCP-transmissions*/
00224    unsigned int rr_count;     /*!< number of RRs we've sent, not including report blocks in SR's */
00225    unsigned int sr_count;     /*!< number of SRs we've sent */
00226    unsigned int lastsrtxcount;     /*!< Transmit packet count when last SR sent */
00227    double accumulated_transit;   /*!< accumulated a-dlsr-lsr */
00228    double rtt;       /*!< Last reported rtt */
00229    unsigned int reported_jitter; /*!< The contents of their last jitter entry in the RR */
00230    unsigned int reported_lost;   /*!< Reported lost packets in their RR */
00231    char quality[AST_MAX_USER_FIELD];
00232    double maxrxjitter;
00233    double minrxjitter;
00234    double maxrtt;
00235    double minrtt;
00236    int sendfur;
00237 };

00242 /* XXX Maybe stun belongs in another file if it ever has use outside of RTP */
00243 struct stun_header {
00244    unsigned short msgtype;
00245    unsigned short msglen;
00246    stun_trans_id  id;
00247    unsigned char ies[0];
00248 } __attribute__((packed));
00249 
00250 struct stun_attr {
00251    unsigned short attr;
00252    unsigned short len;
00253    unsigned char value[0];
00254 } __attribute__((packed));
00255 
00256 struct stun_addr {
00257    unsigned char unused;
00258    unsigned char family;
00259    unsigned short port;
00260    unsigned int addr;
00261 } __attribute__((packed));
00262 
00263 #define STUN_IGNORE     (0)
00264 #define STUN_ACCEPT     (1)
00265 
00266 #define STUN_BINDREQ 0x0001
00267 #define STUN_BINDRESP   0x0101
00268 #define STUN_BINDERR 0x0111
00269 #define STUN_SECREQ  0x0002
00270 #define STUN_SECRESP 0x0102
00271 #define STUN_SECERR  0x0112
00272 
00273 #define STUN_MAPPED_ADDRESS   0x0001
00274 #define STUN_RESPONSE_ADDRESS 0x0002
00275 #define STUN_CHANGE_REQUEST   0x0003
00276 #define STUN_SOURCE_ADDRESS   0x0004
00277 #define STUN_CHANGED_ADDRESS  0x0005
00278 #define STUN_USERNAME      0x0006
00279 #define STUN_PASSWORD      0x0007
00280 #define STUN_MESSAGE_INTEGRITY   0x0008
00281 #define STUN_ERROR_CODE    0x0009
00282 #define STUN_UNKNOWN_ATTRIBUTES  0x000a
00283 #define STUN_REFLECTED_FROM   0x000b
00284 
00285 static const char *stun_msg2str(int msg)
00286 {
00287    switch (msg) {
00288    case STUN_BINDREQ:
00289       return "Binding Request";
00290    case STUN_BINDRESP:
00291       return "Binding Response";
00292    case STUN_BINDERR:
00293       return "Binding Error Response";
00294    case STUN_SECREQ:
00295       return "Shared Secret Request";
00296    case STUN_SECRESP:
00297       return "Shared Secret Response";
00298    case STUN_SECERR:
00299       return "Shared Secret Error Response";
00300    }
00301    return "Non-RFC3489 Message";
00302 }
00303 
00304 static const char *stun_attr2str(int msg)
00305 {
00306    switch (msg) {
00307    case STUN_MAPPED_ADDRESS:
00308       return "Mapped Address";
00309    case STUN_RESPONSE_ADDRESS:
00310       return "Response Address";
00311    case STUN_CHANGE_REQUEST:
00312       return "Change Request";
00313    case STUN_SOURCE_ADDRESS:
00314       return "Source Address";
00315    case STUN_CHANGED_ADDRESS:
00316       return "Changed Address";
00317    case STUN_USERNAME:
00318       return "Username";
00319    case STUN_PASSWORD:
00320       return "Password";
00321    case STUN_MESSAGE_INTEGRITY:
00322       return "Message Integrity";
00323    case STUN_ERROR_CODE:
00324       return "Error Code";
00325    case STUN_UNKNOWN_ATTRIBUTES:
00326       return "Unknown Attributes";
00327    case STUN_REFLECTED_FROM:
00328       return "Reflected From";
00329    }
00330    return "Non-RFC3489 Attribute";
00331 }
00332 
00333 struct stun_state {
00334    const char *username;
00335    const char *password;
00336 };
00337 
00338 static int stun_process_attr(struct stun_state *state, struct stun_attr *attr)
00339 {
00340    if (stundebug)
00341       ast_verbose("Found STUN Attribute %s (%04x), length %d\n",
00342              stun_attr2str(ntohs(attr->attr)), ntohs(attr->attr), ntohs(attr->len));
00343    switch (ntohs(attr->attr)) {
00344    case STUN_USERNAME:
00345       state->username = (const char *) (attr->value);
00346       break;
00347    case STUN_PASSWORD:
00348       state->password = (const char *) (attr->value);
00349       break;
00350    default:
00351       if (stundebug)
00352          ast_verbose("Ignoring STUN attribute %s (%04x), length %d\n", 
00353                 stun_attr2str(ntohs(attr->attr)), ntohs(attr->attr), ntohs(attr->len));
00354    }
00355    return 0;
00356 }
00357 
00358 static void append_attr_string(struct stun_attr **attr, int attrval, const char *s, int *len, int *left)
00359 {
00360    int size = sizeof(**attr) + strlen(s);
00361    if (*left > size) {
00362       (*attr)->attr = htons(attrval);
00363       (*attr)->len = htons(strlen(s));
00364       memcpy((*attr)->value, s, strlen(s));
00365       (*attr) = (struct stun_attr *)((*attr)->value + strlen(s));
00366       *len += size;
00367       *left -= size;
00368    }
00369 }
00370 
00371 static void append_attr_address(struct stun_attr **attr, int attrval, struct sockaddr_in *sin, int *len, int *left)
00372 {
00373    int size = sizeof(**attr) + 8;
00374    struct stun_addr *addr;
00375    if (*left > size) {
00376       (*attr)->attr = htons(attrval);
00377       (*attr)->len = htons(8);
00378       addr = (struct stun_addr *)((*attr)->value);
00379       addr->unused = 0;
00380       addr->family = 0x01;
00381       addr->port = sin->sin_port;
00382       addr->addr = sin->sin_addr.s_addr;
00383       (*attr) = (struct stun_attr *)((*attr)->value + 8);
00384       *len += size;
00385       *left -= size;
00386    }
00387 }
00388 
00389 static int stun_send(int s, struct sockaddr_in *dst, struct stun_header *resp)
00390 {
00391    return sendto(s, resp, ntohs(resp->msglen) + sizeof(*resp), 0,
00392             (struct sockaddr *)dst, sizeof(*dst));
00393 }
00394 
00395 static void stun_req_id(struct stun_header *req)
00396 {
00397    int x;
00398    for (x = 0; x < 4; x++)
00399       req->id.id[x] = ast_random();
00400 }
00401 
00402 size_t ast_rtp_alloc_size(void)
00403 {
00404    return sizeof(struct ast_rtp);
00405 }
00406 
00407 void ast_rtp_stun_request(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct sockaddr_in *suggestion, const char *username)
00408 {
00409    struct stun_header *req;
00410    unsigned char reqdata[1024];
00411    int reqlen, reqleft;
00412    struct stun_attr *attr;
00413    
00414    req = (struct stun_header *)reqdata;
00415    stun_req_id(req);
00416    reqlen = 0;
00417    reqleft = sizeof(reqdata) - sizeof(struct stun_header);
00418    req->msgtype = 0;
00419    req->msglen = 0;
00420    attr = (struct stun_attr *)req->ies;
00421    if (username)
00422       append_attr_string(&attr, STUN_USERNAME, username, &reqlen, &reqleft);
00423    req->msglen = htons(reqlen);
00424    req->msgtype = htons(STUN_BINDREQ);
00425    stun_send(rtp->s, suggestion, req);
00426 }
00427 
00428 static int stun_handle_packet(int s, struct sockaddr_in *src, unsigned char *data, size_t len)
00429 {
00430    struct stun_header *resp, *hdr = (struct stun_header *)data;
00431    struct stun_attr *attr;
00432    struct stun_state st;
00433    int ret = STUN_IGNORE;  
00434    unsigned char respdata[1024];
00435    int resplen, respleft;
00436    
00437    if (len < sizeof(struct stun_header)) {
00438       if (option_debug)
00439          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Runt STUN packet (only %d, wanting at least %d)\n", (int) len, (int) sizeof(struct stun_header));
00440       return -1;
00441    }
00442    if (stundebug)
00443       ast_verbose("STUN Packet, msg %s (%04x), length: %d\n", stun_msg2str(ntohs(hdr->msgtype)), ntohs(hdr->msgtype), ntohs(hdr->msglen));
00444    if (ntohs(hdr->msglen) > len - sizeof(struct stun_header)) {
00445       if (option_debug)
00446          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Scrambled STUN packet length (got %d, expecting %d)\n", ntohs(hdr->msglen), (int)(len - sizeof(struct stun_header)));
00447    } else
00448       len = ntohs(hdr->msglen);
00449    data += sizeof(struct stun_header);
00450    memset(&st, 0, sizeof(st));
00451    while (len) {
00452       if (len < sizeof(struct stun_attr)) {
00453          if (option_debug)
00454             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Runt Attribute (got %d, expecting %d)\n", (int)len, (int) sizeof(struct stun_attr));
00455          break;
00456       }
00457       attr = (struct stun_attr *)data;
00458       if (ntohs(attr->len) > len) {
00459          if (option_debug)
00460             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Inconsistent Attribute (length %d exceeds remaining msg len %d)\n", ntohs(attr->len), (int)len);
00461          break;
00462       }
00463       if (stun_process_attr(&st, attr)) {
00464          if (option_debug)
00465             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Failed to handle attribute %s (%04x)\n", stun_attr2str(ntohs(attr->attr)), ntohs(attr->attr));
00466          break;
00467       }
00468       /* Clear attribute in case previous entry was a string */
00469       attr->attr = 0;
00470       data += ntohs(attr->len) + sizeof(struct stun_attr);
00471       len -= ntohs(attr->len) + sizeof(struct stun_attr);
00472    }
00473    /* Null terminate any string */
00474    *data = '\0';
00475    resp = (struct stun_header *)respdata;
00476    resplen = 0;
00477    respleft = sizeof(respdata) - sizeof(struct stun_header);
00478    resp->id = hdr->id;
00479    resp->msgtype = 0;
00480    resp->msglen = 0;
00481    attr = (struct stun_attr *)resp->ies;
00482    if (!len) {
00483       switch (ntohs(hdr->msgtype)) {
00484       case STUN_BINDREQ:
00485          if (stundebug)
00486             ast_verbose("STUN Bind Request, username: %s\n", 
00487                    st.username ? st.username : "<none>");
00488          if (st.username)
00489             append_attr_string(&attr, STUN_USERNAME, st.username, &resplen, &respleft);
00490          append_attr_address(&attr, STUN_MAPPED_ADDRESS, src, &resplen, &respleft);
00491          resp->msglen = htons(resplen);
00492          resp->msgtype = htons(STUN_BINDRESP);
00493          stun_send(s, src, resp);
00494          ret = STUN_ACCEPT;
00495          break;
00496       default:
00497          if (stundebug)
00498             ast_verbose("Dunno what to do with STUN message %04x (%s)\n", ntohs(hdr->msgtype), stun_msg2str(ntohs(hdr->msgtype)));
00499       }
00500    }
00501    return ret;
00502 }
00503 
00504 /*! \brief List of current sessions */
00505 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(protos, ast_rtp_protocol);
00506 
00507 static void timeval2ntp(struct timeval tv, unsigned int *msw, unsigned int *lsw)
00508 {
00509    unsigned int sec, usec, frac;
00510    sec = tv.tv_sec + 2208988800u; /* Sec between 1900 and 1970 */
00511    usec = tv.tv_usec;
00512    frac = (usec << 12) + (usec << 8) - ((usec * 3650) >> 6);
00513    *msw = sec;
00514    *lsw = frac;
00515 }

00526    return -1;

00529 unsigned int ast_rtcp_calc_interval(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00530 {
00531    unsigned int interval;
00532    /*! \todo XXX Do a more reasonable calculation on this one
00533     * Look in RFC 3550 Section A.7 for an example*/
00534    interval = rtcpinterval;
00535    return interval;
00536 }

00538 /* \brief Put RTP timeout timers on hold during another transaction, like T.38 */
00539 void ast_rtp_set_rtptimers_onhold(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00540 {
00541    rtp->rtptimeout = (-1) * rtp->rtptimeout;
00542    rtp->rtpholdtimeout = (-1) * rtp->rtpholdtimeout;
00543 }

00562 
00563 /*! \brief Get rtp timeout */
00564 int ast_rtp_get_rtptimeout(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00565 {
00566    if (rtp->rtptimeout < 0)   /* We're not checking, but remembering the setting (during T.38 transmission) */
00567       return 0;
00568    return rtp->rtptimeout;
00569 }
00570 
00571 /*! \brief Get rtp hold timeout */
00572 int ast_rtp_get_rtpholdtimeout(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00573 {
00574    if (rtp->rtptimeout < 0)   /* We're not checking, but remembering the setting (during T.38 transmission) */
00575       return 0;
00576    return rtp->rtpholdtimeout;
00577 }
00578 
00579 /*! \brief Get RTP keepalive interval */
00580 int ast_rtp_get_rtpkeepalive(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00581 {
00582    return rtp->rtpkeepalive;
00583 }

00620 static void rtp_bridge_lock(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00621 {
00622 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE
00623    ast_mutex_lock(&rtp->bridge_lock);
00624 #endif
00625    return;
00626 }

00629 {
00630 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE

00632 #endif
00633    return;
00634 }
00635 
00636 static struct ast_frame *send_dtmf(struct ast_rtp *rtp, enum ast_frame_type type)
00637 {
00638    if (((ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE) && type == AST_FRAME_DTMF_END) ||
00639         (type == AST_FRAME_DTMF_BEGIN)) && ast_tvcmp(ast_tvnow(), rtp->dtmfmute) < 0) {
00640       if (option_debug)
00641          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Ignore potential DTMF echo from '%s'\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr));
00642       rtp->resp = 0;
00643       rtp->dtmfsamples = 0;
00644       return &ast_null_frame;
00645    }
00646    if (option_debug)
00647       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Sending dtmf: %d (%c), at %s\n", rtp->resp, rtp->resp, ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr));
00648    if (rtp->resp == 'X') {
00649       rtp->f.frametype = AST_FRAME_CONTROL;
00650       rtp->f.subclass = AST_CONTROL_FLASH;
00651    } else {
00652       rtp->f.frametype = type;
00653       rtp->f.subclass = rtp->resp;
00654    }
00655    rtp->f.datalen = 0;
00656    rtp->f.samples = 0;
00657    rtp->f.mallocd = 0;
00658    rtp->f.src = "RTP";
00659    return &rtp->f;
00660    
00661 }
00662 
00663 static inline int rtp_debug_test_addr(struct sockaddr_in *addr)
00664 {
00665    if (rtpdebug == 0)
00666       return 0;
00667    if (rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr.s_addr) {
00668       if (((ntohs(rtpdebugaddr.sin_port) != 0)
00669            && (rtpdebugaddr.sin_port != addr->sin_port))
00670           || (rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr.s_addr != addr->sin_addr.s_addr))
00671          return 0;
00672    }
00673    return 1;
00674 }
00675 
00676 static inline int rtcp_debug_test_addr(struct sockaddr_in *addr)
00677 {
00678    if (rtcpdebug == 0)
00679       return 0;
00680    if (rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr.s_addr) {
00681       if (((ntohs(rtcpdebugaddr.sin_port) != 0)
00682            && (rtcpdebugaddr.sin_port != addr->sin_port))
00683           || (rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr.s_addr != addr->sin_addr.s_addr))
00684          return 0;
00685    }
00686    return 1;
00687 }
00688 
00689 
00690 static struct ast_frame *process_cisco_dtmf(struct ast_rtp *rtp, unsigned char *data, int len)
00691 {
00692    unsigned int event;
00693    char resp = 0;
00694    struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
00695    unsigned char seq;
00696    unsigned int flags;
00697    unsigned int power;
00698 
00699    /* We should have at least 4 bytes in RTP data */
00700    if (len < 4)
00701       return f;
00702 
00703    /* The format of Cisco RTP DTMF packet looks like next:
00704       +0          - sequence number of DTMF RTP packet (begins from 1,
00705                     wrapped to 0)
00706       +1          - set of flags
00707       +1 (bit 0)     - flaps by different DTMF digits delimited by audio
00708                     or repeated digit without audio???
00709       +2 (+4,+6,...) - power level? (rises from 0 to 32 at begin of tone
00710                     then falls to 0 at its end)
00711       +3 (+5,+7,...) - detected DTMF digit (0..9,*,#,A-D,...)
00712       Repeated DTMF information (bytes 4/5, 6/7) is history shifted right
00713       by each new packet and thus provides some redudancy.
00714       
00715       Sample of Cisco RTP DTMF packet is (all data in hex):
00716          19 07 00 02 12 02 20 02
00717       showing end of DTMF digit '2'.
00718 
00719       The packets
00720          27 07 00 02 0A 02 20 02
00721          28 06 20 02 00 02 0A 02
00722       shows begin of new digit '2' with very short pause (20 ms) after
00723       previous digit '2'. Bit +1.0 flips at begin of new digit.
00724       
00725       Cisco RTP DTMF packets comes as replacement of audio RTP packets
00726       so its uses the same sequencing and timestamping rules as replaced
00727       audio packets. Repeat interval of DTMF packets is 20 ms and not rely
00728       on audio framing parameters. Marker bit isn't used within stream of
00729       DTMFs nor audio stream coming immediately after DTMF stream. Timestamps
00730       are not sequential at borders between DTMF and audio streams,
00731    */
00732 
00733    seq = data[0];
00734    flags = data[1];
00735    power = data[2];
00736    event = data[3] & 0x1f;
00737 
00738    if (option_debug > 2 || rtpdebug)
00739       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Cisco DTMF Digit: %02x (len=%d, seq=%d, flags=%02x, power=%d, history count=%d)\n", event, len, seq, flags, power, (len - 4) / 2);
00740    if (event < 10) {
00741       resp = '0' + event;
00742    } else if (event < 11) {
00743       resp = '*';
00744    } else if (event < 12) {
00745       resp = '#';
00746    } else if (event < 16) {
00747       resp = 'A' + (event - 12);
00748    } else if (event < 17) {
00749       resp = 'X';
00750    }
00751    if ((!rtp->resp && power) || (rtp->resp && (rtp->resp != resp))) {
00752       rtp->resp = resp;
00753       /* Why we should care on DTMF compensation at reception? */
00754       if (!ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE)) {
00755          f = send_dtmf(rtp, AST_FRAME_DTMF_BEGIN);
00756          rtp->dtmfsamples = 0;
00757       }
00758    } else if ((rtp->resp == resp) && !power) {
00759       f = send_dtmf(rtp, AST_FRAME_DTMF_END);
00760       f->samples = rtp->dtmfsamples * 8;
00761       rtp->resp = 0;
00762    } else if (rtp->resp == resp)
00763       rtp->dtmfsamples += 20 * 8;
00764    rtp->dtmfcount = dtmftimeout;
00765    return f;
00766 }
00767 
00768 /*! 
00769  * \brief Process RTP DTMF and events according to RFC 2833.
00770  * 
00771  * RFC 2833 is "RTP Payload for DTMF Digits, Telephony Tones and Telephony Signals".
00772  * 
00773  * \param rtp
00774  * \param data
00775  * \param len
00776  * \param seqno
00777  * \returns
00778  */
00779 static struct ast_frame *process_rfc2833(struct ast_rtp *rtp, unsigned char *data, int len, unsigned int seqno, unsigned int timestamp)
00780 {
00781    unsigned int event;
00782    unsigned int event_end;
00783    unsigned int samples;
00784    char resp = 0;
00785    struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
00786 
00787    /* Figure out event, event end, and samples */
00788    event = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
00789    event >>= 24;
00790    event_end = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
00791    event_end <<= 8;
00792    event_end >>= 24;
00793    samples = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
00794    samples &= 0xFFFF;
00795 
00796    /* Print out debug if turned on */
00797    if (rtpdebug || option_debug > 2)
00798       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "- RTP 2833 Event: %08x (len = %d)\n", event, len);
00799 
00800    /* Figure out what digit was pressed */
00801    if (event < 10) {
00802       resp = '0' + event;
00803    } else if (event < 11) {
00804       resp = '*';
00805    } else if (event < 12) {
00806       resp = '#';
00807    } else if (event < 16) {
00808       resp = 'A' + (event - 12);
00809    } else if (event < 17) {   /* Event 16: Hook flash */
00810       resp = 'X'; 
00811    }
00812    
00813    if (ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE)) {
00814       if ((rtp->lastevent != timestamp) || (rtp->resp && rtp->resp != resp)) {
00815          rtp->resp = resp;
00816          f = send_dtmf(rtp, AST_FRAME_DTMF_END);
00817          f->len = 0;
00818          rtp->lastevent = timestamp;
00819       }
00820    } else {
00821       if ((!(rtp->resp) && (!(event_end & 0x80))) || (rtp->resp && rtp->resp != resp)) {
00822          rtp->resp = resp;
00823          f = send_dtmf(rtp, AST_FRAME_DTMF_BEGIN);
00824       } else if ((event_end & 0x80) && (rtp->lastevent != seqno) && rtp->resp) {
00825          f = send_dtmf(rtp, AST_FRAME_DTMF_END);
00826          f->len = ast_tvdiff_ms(ast_samp2tv(samples, 8000), ast_tv(0, 0)); /* XXX hard coded 8kHz */
00827          rtp->resp = 0;
00828          rtp->lastevent = seqno;
00829       }
00830    }
00831 
00832    rtp->dtmfcount = dtmftimeout;
00833    rtp->dtmfsamples = samples;
00834 
00835    return f;
00836 }
00837 
00838 /*!
00839  * \brief Process Comfort Noise RTP.
00840  * 
00841  * This is incomplete at the moment.
00842  * 
00843 */
00844 static struct ast_frame *process_rfc3389(struct ast_rtp *rtp, unsigned char *data, int len)
00845 {
00846    struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
00847    /* Convert comfort noise into audio with various codecs.  Unfortunately this doesn't
00848       totally help us out becuase we don't have an engine to keep it going and we are not
00849       guaranteed to have it every 20ms or anything */
00850    if (rtpdebug)
00851       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "- RTP 3389 Comfort noise event: Level %d (len = %d)\n", rtp->lastrxformat, len);
00852 
00853    if (!(ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_3389_WARNING))) {
00854       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Comfort noise support incomplete in Asterisk (RFC 3389). Please turn off on client if possible. Client IP: %s\n",
00855          ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr));
00856       ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_3389_WARNING);
00857    }
00858    
00859    /* Must have at least one byte */
00860    if (!len)
00861       return NULL;
00862    if (len < 24) {
00863       rtp->f.data = rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
00864       rtp->f.datalen = len - 1;
00865       rtp->f.offset = AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
00866       memcpy(rtp->f.data, data + 1, len - 1);
00867    } else {
00868       rtp->f.data = NULL;
00869       rtp->f.offset = 0;
00870       rtp->f.datalen = 0;
00871    }
00872    rtp->f.frametype = AST_FRAME_CNG;
00873    rtp->f.subclass = data[0] & 0x7f;
00874    rtp->f.datalen = len - 1;
00875    rtp->f.samples = 0;
00876    rtp->f.delivery.tv_usec = rtp->f.delivery.tv_sec = 0;
00877    f = &rtp->f;
00878    return f;
00879 }
00880 
00881 static int rtpread(int *id, int fd, short events, void *cbdata)
00882 {
00883    struct ast_rtp *rtp = cbdata;
00884    struct ast_frame *f;
00885    f = ast_rtp_read(rtp);
00886    if (f) {
00887       if (rtp->callback)
00888          rtp->callback(rtp, f, rtp->data);
00889    }
00890    return 1;
00891 }
00892 
00893 struct ast_frame *ast_rtcp_read(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
00894 {
00895    socklen_t len;
00896    int position, i, packetwords;
00897    int res;
00898    struct sockaddr_in sin;
00899    unsigned int rtcpdata[8192 + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET];
00900    unsigned int *rtcpheader;
00901    int pt;
00902    struct timeval now;
00903    unsigned int length;
00904    int rc;
00905    double rttsec;
00906    uint64_t rtt = 0;
00907    unsigned int dlsr;
00908    unsigned int lsr;
00909    unsigned int msw;
00910    unsigned int lsw;
00911    unsigned int comp;
00912    struct ast_frame *f = &ast_null_frame;
00913    
00914    if (!rtp || !rtp->rtcp)
00915       return &ast_null_frame;
00916 
00917    len = sizeof(sin);
00918    
00919    res = recvfrom(rtp->rtcp->s, rtcpdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET, sizeof(rtcpdata) - sizeof(unsigned int) * AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET,
00920                0, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &len);
00921    rtcpheader = (unsigned int *)(rtcpdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET);
00922    
00923    if (res < 0) {
00924       if (errno == EBADF)
00925          CRASH;
00926       if (errno != EAGAIN) {
00927          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTCP Read error: %s.  Hanging up.\n", strerror(errno));
00928          return NULL;
00929       }
00930       return &ast_null_frame;
00931    }
00932 
00933    packetwords = res / 4;
00934    
00935    if (rtp->nat) {
00936       /* Send to whoever sent to us */
00937       if ((rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr != sin.sin_addr.s_addr) ||
00938           (rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port != sin.sin_port)) {
00939          memcpy(&rtp->rtcp->them, &sin, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them));
00940          if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
00941             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTCP NAT: Got RTCP from other end. Now sending to address %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
00942       }
00943    }
00944 
00945    if (option_debug)
00946       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Got RTCP report of %d bytes\n", res);
00947 
00948    /* Process a compound packet */
00949    position = 0;
00950    while (position < packetwords) {
00951       i = position;
00952       length = ntohl(rtcpheader[i]);
00953       pt = (length & 0xff0000) >> 16;
00954       rc = (length & 0x1f000000) >> 24;
00955       length &= 0xffff;
00956     
00957       if ((i + length) > packetwords) {
00958          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTCP Read too short\n");
00959          return &ast_null_frame;
00960       }
00961       
00962       if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin)) {
00963          ast_verbose("\n\nGot RTCP from %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(sin.sin_addr), ntohs(sin.sin_port));
00964          ast_verbose("PT: %d(%s)\n", pt, (pt == 200) ? "Sender Report" : (pt == 201) ? "Receiver Report" : (pt == 192) ? "H.261 FUR" : "Unknown");
00965          ast_verbose("Reception reports: %d\n", rc);
00966          ast_verbose("SSRC of sender: %u\n", rtcpheader[i + 1]);
00967       }
00968     
00969       i += 2; /* Advance past header and ssrc */
00970       
00971       switch (pt) {
00972       case RTCP_PT_SR:
00973          gettimeofday(&rtp->rtcp->rxlsr,NULL); /* To be able to populate the dlsr */
00974          rtp->rtcp->spc = ntohl(rtcpheader[i+3]);
00975          rtp->rtcp->soc = ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]);
00976          rtp->rtcp->themrxlsr = ((ntohl(rtcpheader[i]) & 0x0000ffff) << 16) | ((ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 1]) & 0xffff0000) >> 16); /* Going to LSR in RR*/
00977     
00978          if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin)) {
00979             ast_verbose("NTP timestamp: %lu.%010lu\n", (unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i]), (unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 1]) * 4096);
00980             ast_verbose("RTP timestamp: %lu\n", (unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 2]));
00981             ast_verbose("SPC: %lu\tSOC: %lu\n", (unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 3]), (unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]));
00982          }
00983          i += 5;
00984          if (rc < 1)
00985             break;
00986          /* Intentional fall through */
00987       case RTCP_PT_RR:
00988          /* Don't handle multiple reception reports (rc > 1) yet */
00989          /* Calculate RTT per RFC */
00990          gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
00991          timeval2ntp(now, &msw, &lsw);
00992          if (ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]) && ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 5])) { /* We must have the LSR && DLSR */
00993             comp = ((msw & 0xffff) << 16) | ((lsw & 0xffff0000) >> 16);
00994             lsr = ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]);
00995             dlsr = ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 5]);
00996             rtt = comp - lsr - dlsr;
00997 
00998             /* Convert end to end delay to usec (keeping the calculation in 64bit space)
00999                sess->ee_delay = (eedelay * 1000) / 65536; */
01000             if (rtt < 4294) {
01001                 rtt = (rtt * 1000000) >> 16;
01002             } else {
01003                 rtt = (rtt * 1000) >> 16;
01004                 rtt *= 1000;
01005             }
01006             rtt = rtt / 1000.;
01007             rttsec = rtt / 1000.;
01008 
01009             if (comp - dlsr >= lsr) {
01010                rtp->rtcp->accumulated_transit += rttsec;
01011                rtp->rtcp->rtt = rttsec;
01012                if (rtp->rtcp->maxrtt<rttsec)
01013                   rtp->rtcp->maxrtt = rttsec;
01014                if (rtp->rtcp->minrtt>rttsec)
01015                   rtp->rtcp->minrtt = rttsec;
01016             } else {
01017                ast_verbose("Internal RTCP NTP clock skew detected: "
01018                         "lsr=%u, now=%u, dlsr=%u (%d:%03dms), "
01019                         "diff=%d",
01020                         lsr, comp, dlsr, dlsr / 65536,
01021                         (dlsr % 65536) * 1000 / 65536,
01022                         dlsr - (comp - lsr));
01023             }
01024          }
01025 
01026          rtp->rtcp->reported_jitter = ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 3]);
01027          rtp->rtcp->reported_lost = ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 1]) & 0xffffff;
01028          if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin)) {
01029             ast_verbose("  Fraction lost: %ld\n", (((long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 1]) & 0xff000000) >> 24));
01030             ast_verbose("  Packets lost so far: %d\n", rtp->rtcp->reported_lost);
01031             ast_verbose("  Highest sequence number: %ld\n", (long) (ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 2]) & 0xffff));
01032             ast_verbose("  Sequence number cycles: %ld\n", (long) (ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 2]) & 0xffff) >> 16);
01033             ast_verbose("  Interarrival jitter: %u\n", rtp->rtcp->reported_jitter);
01034             ast_verbose("  Last SR(our NTP): %lu.%010lu\n",(unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]) >> 16,((unsigned long) ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 4]) << 16) * 4096);
01035             ast_verbose("  DLSR: %4.4f (sec)\n",ntohl(rtcpheader[i + 5])/65536.0);
01036             if (rtt)
01037                ast_verbose("  RTT: %lu(sec)\n", (unsigned long) rtt);
01038          }
01039          break;
01040       case RTCP_PT_FUR:
01041          if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin))
01042             ast_verbose("Received an RTCP Fast Update Request\n");
01043          rtp->f.frametype = AST_FRAME_CONTROL;
01044          rtp->f.subclass = AST_CONTROL_VIDUPDATE;
01045          rtp->f.datalen = 0;
01046          rtp->f.samples = 0;
01047          rtp->f.mallocd = 0;
01048          rtp->f.src = "RTP";
01049          f = &rtp->f;
01050          break;
01051       case RTCP_PT_SDES:
01052          if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin))
01053             ast_verbose("Received an SDES from %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
01054          break;
01055       case RTCP_PT_BYE:
01056          if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&sin))
01057             ast_verbose("Received a BYE from %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
01058          break;
01059       default:
01060          if (option_debug)
01061             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Unknown RTCP packet (pt=%d) received from %s:%d\n", pt, ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
01062          break;
01063       }
01064       position += (length + 1);
01065    }
01066          
01067    return f;
01068 }
01069 
01070 static void calc_rxstamp(struct timeval *tv, struct ast_rtp *rtp, unsigned int timestamp, int mark)
01071 {
01072    struct timeval now;
01073    double transit;
01074    double current_time;
01075    double d;
01076    double dtv;
01077    double prog;
01078    
01079    if ((!rtp->rxcore.tv_sec && !rtp->rxcore.tv_usec) || mark) {
01080       gettimeofday(&rtp->rxcore, NULL);
01081       rtp->drxcore = (double) rtp->rxcore.tv_sec + (double) rtp->rxcore.tv_usec / 1000000;
01082       /* map timestamp to a real time */
01083       rtp->seedrxts = timestamp; /* Their RTP timestamp started with this */
01084       rtp->rxcore.tv_sec -= timestamp / 8000;
01085       rtp->rxcore.tv_usec -= (timestamp % 8000) * 125;
01086       /* Round to 0.1ms for nice, pretty timestamps */
01087       rtp->rxcore.tv_usec -= rtp->rxcore.tv_usec % 100;
01088       if (rtp->rxcore.tv_usec < 0) {
01089          /* Adjust appropriately if necessary */
01090          rtp->rxcore.tv_usec += 1000000;
01091          rtp->rxcore.tv_sec -= 1;
01092       }
01093    }
01094 
01095    gettimeofday(&now,NULL);
01096    /* rxcore is the mapping between the RTP timestamp and _our_ real time from gettimeofday() */
01097    tv->tv_sec = rtp->rxcore.tv_sec + timestamp / 8000;
01098    tv->tv_usec = rtp->rxcore.tv_usec + (timestamp % 8000) * 125;
01099    if (tv->tv_usec >= 1000000) {
01100       tv->tv_usec -= 1000000;
01101       tv->tv_sec += 1;
01102    }
01103    prog = (double)((timestamp-rtp->seedrxts)/8000.);
01104    dtv = (double)rtp->drxcore + (double)(prog);
01105    current_time = (double)now.tv_sec + (double)now.tv_usec/1000000;
01106    transit = current_time - dtv;
01107    d = transit - rtp->rxtransit;
01108    rtp->rxtransit = transit;
01109    if (d<0)
01110       d=-d;
01111    rtp->rxjitter += (1./16.) * (d - rtp->rxjitter);
01112    if (rtp->rtcp && rtp->rxjitter > rtp->rtcp->maxrxjitter)
01113       rtp->rtcp->maxrxjitter = rtp->rxjitter;
01114    if (rtp->rtcp && rtp->rxjitter < rtp->rtcp->minrxjitter)
01115       rtp->rtcp->minrxjitter = rtp->rxjitter;
01116 }
01117 
01118 /*! \brief Perform a Packet2Packet RTP write */
01119 static int bridge_p2p_rtp_write(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct ast_rtp *bridged, unsigned int *rtpheader, int len, int hdrlen)
01120 {
01121    int res = 0, payload = 0, bridged_payload = 0, version, padding, mark, ext;
01122    struct rtpPayloadType rtpPT;
01123    unsigned int seqno;
01124    
01125    /* Get fields from packet */
01126    seqno = ntohl(rtpheader[0]);
01127    version = (seqno & 0xC0000000) >> 30;
01128    payload = (seqno & 0x7f0000) >> 16;
01129    padding = seqno & (1 << 29);
01130    mark = (seqno & 0x800000) >> 23;
01131    ext = seqno & (1 << 28);
01132    seqno &= 0xffff;
01133 
01134    /* Check what the payload value should be */
01135    rtpPT = ast_rtp_lookup_pt(rtp, payload);
01136 
01137    /* If the payload is DTMF, and we are listening for DTMF - then feed it into the core */
01138    if (ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) && !rtpPT.isAstFormat && rtpPT.code == AST_RTP_DTMF)
01139       return -1;
01140 
01141    /* Otherwise adjust bridged payload to match */
01142    bridged_payload = ast_rtp_lookup_code(bridged, rtpPT.isAstFormat, rtpPT.code);
01143 
01144    /* If the mark bit has not been sent yet... do it now */
01145    if (!ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK)) {
01146       mark = 1;
01147       ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
01148    }
01149 
01150    /* Reconstruct part of the packet */
01151    rtpheader[0] = htonl((version << 30) | (mark << 23) | (bridged_payload << 16) | (seqno));
01152 
01153    /* Send the packet back out */
01154    res = sendto(bridged->s, (void *)rtpheader, len, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&bridged->them, sizeof(bridged->them));
01155    if (res < 0) {
01156       if (!bridged->nat || (bridged->nat && (ast_test_flag(bridged, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE) == FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE))) {
01157          if (option_debug)
01158             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTP Transmission error of packet to %s:%d: %s\n", ast_inet_ntoa(bridged->them.sin_addr), ntohs(bridged->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
01159       } else if (((ast_test_flag(bridged, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE) == FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE) || rtpdebug) && !ast_test_flag(bridged, FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE_NOWARN)) {
01160          if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
01161             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTP NAT: Can't write RTP to private address %s:%d, waiting for other end to send audio...\n", ast_inet_ntoa(bridged->them.sin_addr), ntohs(bridged->them.sin_port));
01162          ast_set_flag(bridged, FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE_NOWARN);
01163       }
01164       return 0;
01165    } else if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&bridged->them))
01166          ast_verbose("Sent RTP P2P packet to %s:%u (type %-2.2d, len %-6.6u)\n", ast_inet_ntoa(bridged->them.sin_addr), ntohs(bridged->them.sin_port), bridged_payload, len - hdrlen);
01167 
01168    return 0;
01169 }
01170 
01171 struct ast_frame *ast_rtp_read(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
01172 {
01173    int res;
01174    struct sockaddr_in sin;
01175    socklen_t len;
01176    unsigned int seqno;
01177    int version;
01178    int payloadtype;
01179    int hdrlen = 12;
01180    int padding;
01181    int mark;
01182    int ext;
01183    unsigned int ssrc;
01184    unsigned int timestamp;
01185    unsigned int *rtpheader;
01186    struct rtpPayloadType rtpPT;
01187    struct ast_rtp *bridged = NULL;
01188    
01189    /* If time is up, kill it */
01190    if (rtp->sending_digit)
01191       ast_rtp_senddigit_continuation(rtp);
01192 
01193    len = sizeof(sin);
01194    
01195    /* Cache where the header will go */
01196    res = recvfrom(rtp->s, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET, sizeof(rtp->rawdata) - AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET,
01197                0, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &len);
01198 
01199    rtpheader = (unsigned int *)(rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET);
01200    if (res < 0) {
01201       if (errno == EBADF)
01202          CRASH;
01203       if (errno != EAGAIN) {
01204          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTP Read error: %s.  Hanging up.\n", strerror(errno));
01205          return NULL;
01206       }
01207       return &ast_null_frame;
01208    }
01209    
01210    if (res < hdrlen) {
01211       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTP Read too short\n");
01212       return &ast_null_frame;
01213    }
01214 
01215    /* Get fields */
01216    seqno = ntohl(rtpheader[0]);
01217 
01218    /* Check RTP version */
01219    version = (seqno & 0xC0000000) >> 30;
01220    if (!version) {
01221       if ((stun_handle_packet(rtp->s, &sin, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET, res) == STUN_ACCEPT) &&
01222          (!rtp->them.sin_port && !rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)) {
01223          memcpy(&rtp->them, &sin, sizeof(rtp->them));
01224       }
01225       return &ast_null_frame;
01226    }
01227 
01228 #if 0 /* Allow to receive RTP stream with closed transmission path */
01229    /* If we don't have the other side's address, then ignore this */
01230    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr || !rtp->them.sin_port)
01231       return &ast_null_frame;
01232 #endif
01233 
01234    /* Send to whoever send to us if NAT is turned on */
01235    if (rtp->nat) {
01236       if ((rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr != sin.sin_addr.s_addr) ||
01237           (rtp->them.sin_port != sin.sin_port)) {
01238          rtp->them = sin;
01239          if (rtp->rtcp) {
01240             memcpy(&rtp->rtcp->them, &sin, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them));
01241             rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port = htons(ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port)+1);
01242          }
01243          rtp->rxseqno = 0;
01244          ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE);
01245          if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
01246             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTP NAT: Got audio from other end. Now sending to address %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port));
01247       }
01248    }
01249 
01250    /* If we are bridged to another RTP stream, send direct */
01251    if ((bridged = ast_rtp_get_bridged(rtp)) && !bridge_p2p_rtp_write(rtp, bridged, rtpheader, res, hdrlen))
01252       return &ast_null_frame;
01253 
01254    if (version != 2)
01255       return &ast_null_frame;
01256 
01257    payloadtype = (seqno & 0x7f0000) >> 16;
01258    padding = seqno & (1 << 29);
01259    mark = seqno & (1 << 23);
01260    ext = seqno & (1 << 28);
01261    seqno &= 0xffff;
01262    timestamp = ntohl(rtpheader[1]);
01263    ssrc = ntohl(rtpheader[2]);
01264    
01265    if (!mark && rtp->rxssrc && rtp->rxssrc != ssrc) {
01266       if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
01267          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Forcing Marker bit, because SSRC has changed\n");
01268       mark = 1;
01269    }
01270 
01271    rtp->rxssrc = ssrc;
01272    
01273    if (padding) {
01274       /* Remove padding bytes */
01275       res -= rtp->rawdata[AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET + res - 1];
01276    }
01277    
01278    if (ext) {
01279       /* RTP Extension present */
01280       hdrlen += 4;
01281       hdrlen += (ntohl(rtpheader[3]) & 0xffff) << 2;
01282       if (option_debug) {
01283          int profile;
01284          profile = (ntohl(rtpheader[3]) & 0xffff0000) >> 16;
01285          if (profile == 0x505a)
01286             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Found Zfone extension in RTP stream - zrtp - not supported.\n");
01287          else
01288             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Found unknown RTP Extensions %x\n", profile);
01289       }
01290    }
01291 
01292    if (res < hdrlen) {
01293       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTP Read too short (%d, expecting %d)\n", res, hdrlen);
01294       return &ast_null_frame;
01295    }
01296 
01297    rtp->rxcount++; /* Only count reasonably valid packets, this'll make the rtcp stats more accurate */
01298 
01299    if (rtp->rxcount==1) {
01300       /* This is the first RTP packet successfully received from source */
01301       rtp->seedrxseqno = seqno;
01302    }
01303 
01304    /* Do not schedule RR if RTCP isn't run */
01305    if (rtp->rtcp && rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr && rtp->rtcp->schedid < 1) {
01306       /* Schedule transmission of Receiver Report */
01307       rtp->rtcp->schedid = ast_sched_add(rtp->sched, ast_rtcp_calc_interval(rtp), ast_rtcp_write, rtp);
01308    }
01309    if ( (int)rtp->lastrxseqno - (int)seqno  > 100) /* if so it would indicate that the sender cycled; allow for misordering */
01310       rtp->cycles += RTP_SEQ_MOD;
01311 
01312    rtp->lastrxseqno = seqno;
01313    
01314    if (rtp->themssrc==0)
01315       rtp->themssrc = ntohl(rtpheader[2]); /* Record their SSRC to put in future RR */
01316    
01317    if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&sin))
01318       ast_verbose("Got  RTP packet from    %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u)\n",
01319          ast_inet_ntoa(sin.sin_addr), ntohs(sin.sin_port), payloadtype, seqno, timestamp,res - hdrlen);
01320 
01321    rtpPT = ast_rtp_lookup_pt(rtp, payloadtype);
01322    if (!rtpPT.isAstFormat) {
01323       struct ast_frame *f = NULL;
01324 
01325       /* This is special in-band data that's not one of our codecs */
01326       if (rtpPT.code == AST_RTP_DTMF) {
01327          /* It's special -- rfc2833 process it */
01328          if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&sin)) {
01329             unsigned char *data;
01330             unsigned int event;
01331             unsigned int event_end;
01332             unsigned int duration;
01333             data = rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET + hdrlen;
01334             event = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
01335             event >>= 24;
01336             event_end = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
01337             event_end <<= 8;
01338             event_end >>= 24;
01339             duration = ntohl(*((unsigned int *)(data)));
01340             duration &= 0xFFFF;
01341             ast_verbose("Got  RTP RFC2833 from   %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u, mark %d, event %08x, end %d, duration %-5.5d) \n", ast_inet_ntoa(sin.sin_addr), ntohs(sin.sin_port), payloadtype, seqno, timestamp, res - hdrlen, (mark?1:0), event, ((event_end & 0x80)?1:0), duration);
01342          }
01343          f = process_rfc2833(rtp, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET + hdrlen, res - hdrlen, seqno, timestamp);
01344       } else if (rtpPT.code == AST_RTP_CISCO_DTMF) {
01345          /* It's really special -- process it the Cisco way */
01346          if (rtp->lastevent <= seqno || (rtp->lastevent >= 65530 && seqno <= 6)) {
01347             f = process_cisco_dtmf(rtp, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET + hdrlen, res - hdrlen);
01348             rtp->lastevent = seqno;
01349          }
01350       } else if (rtpPT.code == AST_RTP_CN) {
01351          /* Comfort Noise */
01352          f = process_rfc3389(rtp, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET + hdrlen, res - hdrlen);
01353       } else {
01354          ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Unknown RTP codec %d received from '%s'\n", payloadtype, ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr));
01355       }
01356       return f ? f : &ast_null_frame;
01357    }
01358    rtp->lastrxformat = rtp->f.subclass = rtpPT.code;
01359    rtp->f.frametype = (rtp->f.subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_AUDIO) ? AST_FRAME_VOICE : (rtp->f.subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_VIDEO) ? AST_FRAME_VIDEO : AST_FRAME_TEXT;
01360 
01361    if (!rtp->lastrxts)
01362       rtp->lastrxts = timestamp;
01363 
01364    rtp->rxseqno = seqno;
01365 
01366    /* Record received timestamp as last received now */
01367    rtp->lastrxts = timestamp;
01368 
01369    rtp->f.mallocd = 0;
01370    rtp->f.datalen = res - hdrlen;
01371    rtp->f.data = rtp->rawdata + hdrlen + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
01372    rtp->f.offset = hdrlen + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET;
01373    if (rtp->f.subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_AUDIO) {
01374       rtp->f.samples = ast_codec_get_samples(&rtp->f);
01375       if (rtp->f.subclass == AST_FORMAT_SLINEAR) 
01376          ast_frame_byteswap_be(&rtp->f);
01377       calc_rxstamp(&rtp->f.delivery, rtp, timestamp, mark);
01378       /* Add timing data to let ast_generic_bridge() put the frame into a jitterbuf */
01379       rtp->f.has_timing_info = 1;
01380       rtp->f.ts = timestamp / 8;
01381       rtp->f.len = rtp->f.samples / 8;
01382       rtp->f.seqno = seqno;
01383    } else if(rtp->f.subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_VIDEO) {
01384       /* Video -- samples is # of samples vs. 90000 */
01385       if (!rtp->lastividtimestamp)
01386          rtp->lastividtimestamp = timestamp;
01387       rtp->f.samples = timestamp - rtp->lastividtimestamp;
01388       rtp->lastividtimestamp = timestamp;
01389       rtp->f.delivery.tv_sec = 0;
01390       rtp->f.delivery.tv_usec = 0;
01391       if (mark)
01392          rtp->f.subclass |= 0x1;
01393    } else {
01394       /* TEXT -- samples is # of samples vs. 1000 */
01395       if (!rtp->lastitexttimestamp)
01396          rtp->lastitexttimestamp = timestamp;
01397       rtp->f.samples = timestamp - rtp->lastitexttimestamp;
01398       rtp->lastitexttimestamp = timestamp;
01399       rtp->f.delivery.tv_sec = 0;
01400       rtp->f.delivery.tv_usec = 0;
01401    }
01402    rtp->f.src = "RTP";
01403    return &rtp->f;
01404 }
01405

01407    of our codecs, or RTP-specific data type. */

01411    char* subtype;
01412 } mimeTypes[] = {
01413    {{1, AST_FORMAT_G723_1}, "audio", "G723"},

01438 
01439 /* Static (i.e., well-known) RTP payload types for our "AST_FORMAT..."s:
01440    also, our own choices for dynamic payload types.  This is our master
01441    table for transmission */
01442 static struct rtpPayloadType static_RTP_PT[MAX_RTP_PT] = {
01443    [0] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ULAW},
01444 #ifdef USE_DEPRECATED_G726
01445    [2] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G726}, /* Technically this is G.721, but if Cisco can do it, so can we... */
01446 #endif
01447    [3] = {1, AST_FORMAT_GSM},
01448    [4] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G723_1},
01449    [5] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ADPCM}, /* 8 kHz */
01450    [6] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ADPCM}, /* 16 kHz */
01451    [7] = {1, AST_FORMAT_LPC10},
01452    [8] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ALAW},
01453    [9] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G722},
01454    [10] = {1, AST_FORMAT_SLINEAR}, /* 2 channels */
01455    [11] = {1, AST_FORMAT_SLINEAR}, /* 1 channel */
01456    [13] = {0, AST_RTP_CN},
01457    [16] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ADPCM}, /* 11.025 kHz */
01458    [17] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ADPCM}, /* 22.050 kHz */
01459    [18] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G729A},
01460    [19] = {0, AST_RTP_CN},    /* Also used for CN */
01461    [26] = {1, AST_FORMAT_JPEG},
01462    [31] = {1, AST_FORMAT_H261},
01463    [34] = {1, AST_FORMAT_H263},
01464    [97] = {1, AST_FORMAT_ILBC},
01465    [99] = {1, AST_FORMAT_H264},
01466    [101] = {0, AST_RTP_DTMF},
01467    [102] = {1, AST_FORMAT_T140}, /* Real time text chat */
01468    [103] = {1, AST_FORMAT_H263_PLUS},
01469    [104] = {1, AST_FORMAT_MP4_VIDEO},
01470    [110] = {1, AST_FORMAT_SPEEX},
01471    [111] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G726},
01472    [112] = {1, AST_FORMAT_G726_AAL2},
01473    [121] = {0, AST_RTP_CISCO_DTMF}, /* Must be type 121 */
01474 };
01475 
01476 void ast_rtp_pt_clear(struct ast_rtp* rtp) 
01477 {
01478    int i;
01479 
01480    if (!rtp)
01481       return;
01482 
01483    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01484 
01485    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RTP_PT; ++i) {
01486       rtp->current_RTP_PT[i].isAstFormat = 0;
01487       rtp->current_RTP_PT[i].code = 0;
01488    }
01489 
01490    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat = 0;
01491    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code = 0;
01492    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result = 0;
01493 
01494    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01495 }
01496 
01497 void ast_rtp_pt_default(struct ast_rtp* rtp) 
01498 {
01499    int i;
01500 
01501    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01502 
01503    /* Initialize to default payload types */
01504    for (i = 0; i < MAX_RTP_PT; ++i) {
01505       rtp->current_RTP_PT[i].isAstFormat = static_RTP_PT[i].isAstFormat;
01506       rtp->current_RTP_PT[i].code = static_RTP_PT[i].code;
01507    }
01508 
01509    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat = 0;
01510    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code = 0;
01511    rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result = 0;
01512 
01513    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01514 }
01515 
01516 void ast_rtp_pt_copy(struct ast_rtp *dest, struct ast_rtp *src)
01517 {
01518    unsigned int i;
01519 
01520    rtp_bridge_lock(dest);
01521    rtp_bridge_lock(src);
01522 
01523    for (i=0; i < MAX_RTP_PT; ++i) {
01524       dest->current_RTP_PT[i].isAstFormat = 
01525          src->current_RTP_PT[i].isAstFormat;
01526       dest->current_RTP_PT[i].code = 
01527          src->current_RTP_PT[i].code; 
01528    }
01529    dest->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat = 0;
01530    dest->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code = 0;
01531    dest->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result = 0;
01532 
01533    rtp_bridge_unlock(src);
01534    rtp_bridge_unlock(dest);
01535 }
01536 
01537 /*! \brief Get channel driver interface structure */
01538 static struct ast_rtp_protocol *get_proto(struct ast_channel *chan)
01539 {
01540    struct ast_rtp_protocol *cur = NULL;
01541 
01542    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&protos);
01543    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&protos, cur, list) {
01544       if (cur->type == chan->tech->type)
01545          break;
01546    }
01547    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&protos);
01548 
01549    return cur;
01550 }
01551 
01552 int ast_rtp_early_bridge(struct ast_channel *c0, struct ast_channel *c1)
01553 {
01554    // dest = c0, src = c1
01555    struct ast_rtp *destp = NULL, *srcp = NULL;     /* Audio RTP Channels */
01556    struct ast_rtp *vdestp = NULL, *vsrcp = NULL;      /* Video RTP channels */
01557    struct ast_rtp *tdestp = NULL, *tsrcp = NULL;      /* Text RTP channels */
01558    struct ast_rtp_protocol *destpr = NULL, *srcpr = NULL;
01559    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01560    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01561    int srccodec, destcodec, nat_active = 0;
01562 
01563    /* Lock channels */
01564    ast_channel_lock(c0);
01565    if (c1) {
01566       while (ast_channel_trylock(c1)) {
01567          ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01568          usleep(1);
01569          ast_channel_lock(c0);
01570       }
01571    }
01572 
01573    /* Find channel driver interfaces */
01574    destpr = get_proto(c0);
01575    if (c1)
01576       srcpr = get_proto(c1);
01577    if (!destpr) {
01578       if (option_debug)
01579          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel '%s' has no RTP, not doing anything\n", c0->name);
01580       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01581       if (c1)
01582          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01583       return -1;
01584    }
01585    if (!srcpr) {
01586       if (option_debug)
01587          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel '%s' has no RTP, not doing anything\n", c1 ? c1->name : "<unspecified>");
01588       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01589       if (c1)
01590          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01591       return -1;
01592    }
01593 
01594    /* Get audio, video  and text interface (if native bridge is possible) */
01595    audio_dest_res = destpr->get_rtp_info(c0, &destp);
01596    video_dest_res = destpr->get_vrtp_info ? destpr->get_vrtp_info(c0, &vdestp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01597    text_dest_res = destpr->get_trtp_info ? destpr->get_trtp_info(c0, &tdestp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01598    if (srcpr) {
01599       audio_src_res = srcpr->get_rtp_info(c1, &srcp);
01600       video_src_res = srcpr->get_vrtp_info ? srcpr->get_vrtp_info(c1, &vsrcp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01601       text_src_res = srcpr->get_trtp_info ? srcpr->get_trtp_info(c1, &tsrcp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01602    }
01603 
01604    /* Check if bridge is still possible (In SIP canreinvite=no stops this, like NAT) */
01605    if (audio_dest_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE) {
01606       /* Somebody doesn't want to play... */
01607       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01608       if (c1)
01609          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01610       return -1;
01611    }
01612    if (audio_src_res == AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE && srcpr->get_codec)
01613       srccodec = srcpr->get_codec(c1);
01614    else
01615       srccodec = 0;
01616    if (audio_dest_res == AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE && destpr->get_codec)
01617       destcodec = destpr->get_codec(c0);
01618    else
01619       destcodec = 0;
01620    /* Ensure we have at least one matching codec */
01621    if (!(srccodec & destcodec)) {
01622       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01623       if (c1)
01624          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01625       return 0;
01626    }
01627    /* Consider empty media as non-existant */
01628    if (audio_src_res == AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE && !srcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)
01629       srcp = NULL;
01630    if (srcp && (srcp->nat || ast_test_flag(srcp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))
01631       nat_active = 1;
01632    /* Bridge media early */
01633    if (destpr->set_rtp_peer(c0, srcp, vsrcp, tsrcp, srccodec, nat_active))
01634       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to setup early bridge to '%s'\n", c0->name, c1 ? c1->name : "<unspecified>");
01635    ast_channel_unlock(c0);
01636    if (c1)
01637       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
01638    if (option_debug)
01639       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Setting early bridge SDP of '%s' with that of '%s'\n", c0->name, c1 ? c1->name : "<unspecified>");
01640    return 0;
01641 }
01642 
01643 int ast_rtp_make_compatible(struct ast_channel *dest, struct ast_channel *src, int media)
01644 {
01645    struct ast_rtp *destp = NULL, *srcp = NULL;     /* Audio RTP Channels */
01646    struct ast_rtp *vdestp = NULL, *vsrcp = NULL;      /* Video RTP channels */
01647    struct ast_rtp *tdestp = NULL, *tsrcp = NULL;      /* Text RTP channels */
01648    struct ast_rtp_protocol *destpr = NULL, *srcpr = NULL;
01649    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_dest_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01650    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_src_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED; 
01651    int srccodec, destcodec;
01652 
01653    /* Lock channels */
01654    ast_channel_lock(dest);
01655    while (ast_channel_trylock(src)) {
01656       ast_channel_unlock(dest);
01657       usleep(1);
01658       ast_channel_lock(dest);
01659    }
01660 
01661    /* Find channel driver interfaces */
01662    if (!(destpr = get_proto(dest))) {
01663       if (option_debug)
01664          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel '%s' has no RTP, not doing anything\n", dest->name);
01665       ast_channel_unlock(dest);
01666       ast_channel_unlock(src);
01667       return 0;
01668    }
01669    if (!(srcpr = get_proto(src))) {
01670       if (option_debug)
01671          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel '%s' has no RTP, not doing anything\n", src->name);
01672       ast_channel_unlock(dest);
01673       ast_channel_unlock(src);
01674       return 0;
01675    }
01676 
01677    /* Get audio and video interface (if native bridge is possible) */
01678    audio_dest_res = destpr->get_rtp_info(dest, &destp);
01679    video_dest_res = destpr->get_vrtp_info ? destpr->get_vrtp_info(dest, &vdestp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01680    text_dest_res = destpr->get_trtp_info ? destpr->get_trtp_info(dest, &tdestp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01681    audio_src_res = srcpr->get_rtp_info(src, &srcp);
01682    video_src_res = srcpr->get_vrtp_info ? srcpr->get_vrtp_info(src, &vsrcp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01683    text_src_res = srcpr->get_trtp_info ? srcpr->get_trtp_info(src, &tsrcp) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
01684 
01685    /* Ensure we have at least one matching codec */
01686    if (srcpr->get_codec)
01687       srccodec = srcpr->get_codec(src);
01688    else
01689       srccodec = 0;
01690    if (destpr->get_codec)
01691       destcodec = destpr->get_codec(dest);
01692    else
01693       destcodec = 0;
01694 
01695    /* Check if bridge is still possible (In SIP canreinvite=no stops this, like NAT) */
01696    if (audio_dest_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || audio_src_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || !(srccodec & destcodec)) {
01697       /* Somebody doesn't want to play... */
01698       ast_channel_unlock(dest);
01699       ast_channel_unlock(src);
01700       return 0;
01701    }
01702    ast_rtp_pt_copy(destp, srcp);
01703    if (vdestp && vsrcp)
01704       ast_rtp_pt_copy(vdestp, vsrcp);
01705    if (tdestp && tsrcp)
01706       ast_rtp_pt_copy(tdestp, tsrcp);
01707    if (media) {
01708       /* Bridge early */
01709       if (destpr->set_rtp_peer(dest, srcp, vsrcp, tsrcp, srccodec, ast_test_flag(srcp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))
01710          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to setup early bridge to '%s'\n", dest->name, src->name);
01711    }
01712    ast_channel_unlock(dest);
01713    ast_channel_unlock(src);
01714    if (option_debug)
01715       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Seeded SDP of '%s' with that of '%s'\n", dest->name, src->name);
01716    return 1;
01717 }
01718 
01719 /*! \brief  Make a note of a RTP payload type that was seen in a SDP "m=" line.
01720  * By default, use the well-known value for this type (although it may 
01721  * still be set to a different value by a subsequent "a=rtpmap:" line)
01722  */
01723 void ast_rtp_set_m_type(struct ast_rtp* rtp, int pt) 
01724 {
01725    if (pt < 0 || pt > MAX_RTP_PT || static_RTP_PT[pt].code == 0) 
01726       return; /* bogus payload type */
01727 
01728    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01729    rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt] = static_RTP_PT[pt];
01730    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01731 } 
01732 
01733 /*! \brief Make a note of a RTP payload type (with MIME type) that was seen in
01734  * an SDP "a=rtpmap:" line.
01735  */
01736 void ast_rtp_set_rtpmap_type(struct ast_rtp *rtp, int pt,
01737               char *mimeType, char *mimeSubtype,
01738               enum ast_rtp_options options)
01739 {
01740    unsigned int i;
01741 
01742    if (pt < 0 || pt > MAX_RTP_PT) 
01743       return; /* bogus payload type */
01744    
01745    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01746 
01747    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(mimeTypes)/sizeof(mimeTypes[0]); ++i) {
01748       if (strcasecmp(mimeSubtype, mimeTypes[i].subtype) == 0 &&
01749           strcasecmp(mimeType, mimeTypes[i].type) == 0) {
01750          rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt] = mimeTypes[i].payloadType;
01751          if ((mimeTypes[i].payloadType.code == AST_FORMAT_G726) &&
01752              mimeTypes[i].payloadType.isAstFormat &&
01753              (options & AST_RTP_OPT_G726_NONSTANDARD))
01754             rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].code = AST_FORMAT_G726_AAL2;
01755          break;
01756       }
01757    }
01758 
01759    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01760 
01761    return;
01762 } 
01763 
01764 /*! \brief Return the union of all of the codecs that were set by rtp_set...() calls 
01765  * They're returned as two distinct sets: AST_FORMATs, and AST_RTPs */
01766 void ast_rtp_get_current_formats(struct ast_rtp* rtp,
01767              int* astFormats, int* nonAstFormats)
01768 {
01769    int pt;
01770    
01771    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01772    
01773    *astFormats = *nonAstFormats = 0;
01774    for (pt = 0; pt < MAX_RTP_PT; ++pt) {
01775       if (rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].isAstFormat) {
01776          *astFormats |= rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].code;
01777       } else {
01778          *nonAstFormats |= rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].code;
01779       }
01780    }
01781 
01782    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01783    
01784    return;
01785 }
01786 
01787 struct rtpPayloadType ast_rtp_lookup_pt(struct ast_rtp* rtp, int pt) 
01788 {
01789    struct rtpPayloadType result;
01790 
01791    result.isAstFormat = result.code = 0;
01792 
01793    if (pt < 0 || pt > MAX_RTP_PT) 
01794       return result; /* bogus payload type */
01795 
01796    /* Start with negotiated codecs */
01797    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01798    result = rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt];
01799    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01800 
01801    /* If it doesn't exist, check our static RTP type list, just in case */
01802    if (!result.code) 
01803       result = static_RTP_PT[pt];
01804 
01805    return result;
01806 }
01807 
01808 /*! \brief Looks up an RTP code out of our *static* outbound list */
01809 int ast_rtp_lookup_code(struct ast_rtp* rtp, const int isAstFormat, const int code)
01810 {
01811    int pt = 0;
01812 
01813    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
01814 
01815    if (isAstFormat == rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat &&
01816       code == rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code) {
01817       /* Use our cached mapping, to avoid the overhead of the loop below */
01818       pt = rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result;
01819       rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01820       return pt;
01821    }
01822 
01823    /* Check the dynamic list first */
01824    for (pt = 0; pt < MAX_RTP_PT; ++pt) {
01825       if (rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].code == code && rtp->current_RTP_PT[pt].isAstFormat == isAstFormat) {
01826          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat = isAstFormat;
01827          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code = code;
01828          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result = pt;
01829          rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01830          return pt;
01831       }
01832    }
01833 
01834    /* Then the static list */
01835    for (pt = 0; pt < MAX_RTP_PT; ++pt) {
01836       if (static_RTP_PT[pt].code == code && static_RTP_PT[pt].isAstFormat == isAstFormat) {
01837          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_isAstFormat = isAstFormat;
01838          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_code = code;
01839          rtp->rtp_lookup_code_cache_result = pt;
01840          rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01841          return pt;
01842       }
01843    }
01844 
01845    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
01846 
01847    return -1;
01848 }
01849 
01850 const char *ast_rtp_lookup_mime_subtype(const int isAstFormat, const int code,
01851               enum ast_rtp_options options)
01852 {
01853    unsigned int i;
01854 
01855    for (i = 0; i < sizeof(mimeTypes)/sizeof(mimeTypes[0]); ++i) {
01856       if ((mimeTypes[i].payloadType.code == code) && (mimeTypes[i].payloadType.isAstFormat == isAstFormat)) {
01857          if (isAstFormat &&
01858              (code == AST_FORMAT_G726_AAL2) &&
01859              (options & AST_RTP_OPT_G726_NONSTANDARD))
01860             return "G726-32";
01861          else
01862             return mimeTypes[i].subtype;
01863       }
01864    }
01865 
01866    return "";
01867 }
01868 
01869 char *ast_rtp_lookup_mime_multiple(char *buf, size_t size, const int capability,
01870                const int isAstFormat, enum ast_rtp_options options)
01871 {
01872    int format;
01873    unsigned len;
01874    char *end = buf;
01875    char *start = buf;
01876 
01877    if (!buf || !size)
01878       return NULL;
01879 
01880    snprintf(end, size, "0x%x (", capability);
01881 
01882    len = strlen(end);
01883    end += len;
01884    size -= len;
01885    start = end;
01886 
01887    for (format = 1; format < AST_RTP_MAX; format <<= 1) {
01888       if (capability & format) {
01889          const char *name = ast_rtp_lookup_mime_subtype(isAstFormat, format, options);
01890 
01891          snprintf(end, size, "%s|", name);
01892          len = strlen(end);
01893          end += len;
01894          size -= len;
01895       }
01896    }
01897 
01898    if (start == end)
01899       snprintf(start, size, "nothing)"); 
01900    else if (size > 1)
01901       *(end -1) = ')';
01902    
01903    return buf;
01904 }
01905 
01906 /*! \brief Open RTP or RTCP socket for a session */
01907 static int rtp_socket(void)
01908 {
01909    int s;
01910    long flags;
01911    s = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, 0);
01912    if (s > -1) {
01913       flags = fcntl(s, F_GETFL);
01914       fcntl(s, F_SETFL, flags | O_NONBLOCK);
01915 #ifdef SO_NO_CHECK
01916       if (nochecksums)
01917          setsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, SO_NO_CHECK, &nochecksums, sizeof(nochecksums));
01918 #endif
01919    }
01920    return s;
01921 }
01922 
01923 /*!
01924  * \brief Initialize a new RTCP session.
01925  * 
01926  * \returns The newly initialized RTCP session.
01927  */
01928 static struct ast_rtcp *ast_rtcp_new(void)
01929 {
01930    struct ast_rtcp *rtcp;
01931 
01932    if (!(rtcp = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*rtcp))))
01933       return NULL;
01934    rtcp->s = rtp_socket();
01935    rtcp->us.sin_family = AF_INET;
01936    rtcp->them.sin_family = AF_INET;
01937 
01938    if (rtcp->s < 0) {
01939       free(rtcp);
01940       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to allocate RTCP socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01941       return NULL;
01942    }
01943 
01944    return rtcp;
01945 }
01946 
01947 /*!
01948  * \brief Initialize a new RTP structure.
01949  *
01950  */
01951 void ast_rtp_new_init(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
01952 {
01953 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE
01954    ast_mutex_init(&rtp->bridge_lock);
01955 #endif
01956 
01957    rtp->them.sin_family = AF_INET;
01958    rtp->us.sin_family = AF_INET;
01959    rtp->ssrc = ast_random();
01960    rtp->seqno = ast_random() & 0xffff;
01961    ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_HAS_DTMF);
01962 
01963    return;
01964 }
01965 
01966 struct ast_rtp *ast_rtp_new_with_bindaddr(struct sched_context *sched, struct io_context *io, int rtcpenable, int callbackmode, struct in_addr addr)
01967 {
01968    struct ast_rtp *rtp;
01969    int x;
01970    int first;
01971    int startplace;
01972    
01973    if (!(rtp = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*rtp))))
01974       return NULL;
01975 
01976    ast_rtp_new_init(rtp);
01977 
01978    rtp->s = rtp_socket();
01979    if (rtp->s < 0) {
01980       free(rtp);
01981       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to allocate socket: %s\n", strerror(errno));
01982       return NULL;
01983    }
01984    if (sched && rtcpenable) {
01985       rtp->sched = sched;
01986       rtp->rtcp = ast_rtcp_new();
01987    }
01988    
01989    /* Select a random port number in the range of possible RTP */
01990    x = (ast_random() % (rtpend-rtpstart)) + rtpstart;
01991    x = x & ~1;
01992    /* Save it for future references. */
01993    startplace = x;
01994    /* Iterate tring to bind that port and incrementing it otherwise untill a port was found or no ports are available. */
01995    for (;;) {
01996       /* Must be an even port number by RTP spec */
01997       rtp->us.sin_port = htons(x);
01998       rtp->us.sin_addr = addr;
01999 
02000       /* If there's rtcp, initialize it as well. */
02001       if (rtp->rtcp) {
02002          rtp->rtcp->us.sin_port = htons(x + 1);
02003          rtp->rtcp->us.sin_addr = addr;
02004       }
02005       /* Try to bind it/them. */
02006       if (!(first = bind(rtp->s, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->us, sizeof(rtp->us))) &&
02007          (!rtp->rtcp || !bind(rtp->rtcp->s, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->rtcp->us, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->us))))
02008          break;
02009       if (!first) {
02010          /* Primary bind succeeded! Gotta recreate it */
02011          close(rtp->s);
02012          rtp->s = rtp_socket();
02013       }
02014       if (errno != EADDRINUSE) {
02015          /* We got an error that wasn't expected, abort! */
02016          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unexpected bind error: %s\n", strerror(errno));
02017          close(rtp->s);
02018          if (rtp->rtcp) {
02019             close(rtp->rtcp->s);
02020             free(rtp->rtcp);
02021          }
02022          free(rtp);
02023          return NULL;
02024       }
02025       /* The port was used, increment it (by two). */
02026       x += 2;
02027       /* Did we go over the limit ? */
02028       if (x > rtpend)
02029          /* then, start from the begingig. */
02030          x = (rtpstart + 1) & ~1;
02031       /* Check if we reached the place were we started. */
02032       if (x == startplace) {
02033          /* If so, there's no ports available. */
02034          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "No RTP ports remaining. Can't setup media stream for this call.\n");
02035          close(rtp->s);
02036          if (rtp->rtcp) {
02037             close(rtp->rtcp->s);
02038             free(rtp->rtcp);
02039          }
02040          free(rtp);
02041          return NULL;
02042       }
02043    }
02044    rtp->sched = sched;
02045    rtp->io = io;
02046    if (callbackmode) {
02047       rtp->ioid = ast_io_add(rtp->io, rtp->s, rtpread, AST_IO_IN, rtp);
02048       ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_CALLBACK_MODE);
02049    }
02050    ast_rtp_pt_default(rtp);
02051    return rtp;
02052 }
02053 
02054 struct ast_rtp *ast_rtp_new(struct sched_context *sched, struct io_context *io, int rtcpenable, int callbackmode)
02055 {
02056    struct in_addr ia;
02057 
02058    memset(&ia, 0, sizeof(ia));
02059    return ast_rtp_new_with_bindaddr(sched, io, rtcpenable, callbackmode, ia);
02060 }
02061 
02062 int ast_rtp_setqos(struct ast_rtp *rtp, int tos, int cos)
02063 {
02064    return ast_netsock_set_qos(rtp->s, tos, cos);
02065 }
02066 
02067 void ast_rtp_set_peer(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct sockaddr_in *them)
02068 {
02069    rtp->them.sin_port = them->sin_port;
02070    rtp->them.sin_addr = them->sin_addr;
02071    if (rtp->rtcp) {
02072       rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port = htons(ntohs(them->sin_port) + 1);
02073       rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr = them->sin_addr;
02074    }
02075    rtp->rxseqno = 0;
02076 }
02077 
02078 int ast_rtp_get_peer(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct sockaddr_in *them)
02079 {
02080    if ((them->sin_family != AF_INET) ||
02081       (them->sin_port != rtp->them.sin_port) ||
02082       (them->sin_addr.s_addr != rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)) {
02083       them->sin_family = AF_INET;
02084       them->sin_port = rtp->them.sin_port;
02085       them->sin_addr = rtp->them.sin_addr;
02086       return 1;
02087    }
02088    return 0;
02089 }
02090 
02091 void ast_rtp_get_us(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct sockaddr_in *us)
02092 {
02093    *us = rtp->us;
02094 }
02095 
02096 struct ast_rtp *ast_rtp_get_bridged(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02097 {
02098    struct ast_rtp *bridged = NULL;
02099 
02100    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp);
02101    bridged = rtp->bridged;
02102    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp);
02103 
02104    return bridged;
02105 }
02106 
02107 void ast_rtp_stop(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02108 {
02109    if (rtp->rtcp && rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0) {
02110       ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02111       rtp->rtcp->schedid = -1;
02112    }
02113 
02114    memset(&rtp->them.sin_addr, 0, sizeof(rtp->them.sin_addr));
02115    memset(&rtp->them.sin_port, 0, sizeof(rtp->them.sin_port));
02116    if (rtp->rtcp) {
02117       memset(&rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr, 0, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr));
02118       memset(&rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port, 0, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
02119    }
02120    
02121    ast_clear_flag(rtp, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
02122 }
02123 
02124 void ast_rtp_reset(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02125 {
02126    memset(&rtp->rxcore, 0, sizeof(rtp->rxcore));
02127    memset(&rtp->txcore, 0, sizeof(rtp->txcore));
02128    memset(&rtp->dtmfmute, 0, sizeof(rtp->dtmfmute));
02129    rtp->lastts = 0;
02130    rtp->lastdigitts = 0;
02131    rtp->lastrxts = 0;
02132    rtp->lastividtimestamp = 0;
02133    rtp->lastovidtimestamp = 0;
02134    rtp->lastitexttimestamp = 0;
02135    rtp->lastotexttimestamp = 0;
02136    rtp->lasteventseqn = 0;
02137    rtp->lastevent = 0;
02138    rtp->lasttxformat = 0;
02139    rtp->lastrxformat = 0;
02140    rtp->dtmfcount = 0;
02141    rtp->dtmfsamples = 0;
02142    rtp->seqno = 0;
02143    rtp->rxseqno = 0;
02144 }
02145 
02146 char *ast_rtp_get_quality(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct ast_rtp_quality *qual)
02147 {
02148    /*
02149    *ssrc          our ssrc
02150    *themssrc      their ssrc
02151    *lp            lost packets
02152    *rxjitter      our calculated jitter(rx)
02153    *rxcount       no. received packets
02154    *txjitter      reported jitter of the other end
02155    *txcount       transmitted packets
02156    *rlp           remote lost packets
02157    *rtt           round trip time
02158    */
02159 
02160    if (qual) {
02161       qual->local_ssrc = rtp->ssrc;
02162       qual->local_lostpackets = rtp->rtcp->expected_prior - rtp->rtcp->received_prior;
02163       qual->local_jitter = rtp->rxjitter;
02164       qual->local_count = rtp->rxcount;
02165       qual->remote_ssrc = rtp->themssrc;
02166       qual->remote_lostpackets = rtp->rtcp->reported_lost;
02167       qual->remote_jitter = rtp->rtcp->reported_jitter / 65536.0;
02168       qual->remote_count = rtp->txcount;
02169       qual->rtt = rtp->rtcp->rtt;
02170    }
02171    snprintf(rtp->rtcp->quality, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->quality), "ssrc=%u;themssrc=%u;lp=%u;rxjitter=%f;rxcount=%u;txjitter=%f;txcount=%u;rlp=%u;rtt=%f", rtp->ssrc, rtp->themssrc, rtp->rtcp->expected_prior - rtp->rtcp->received_prior, rtp->rxjitter, rtp->rxcount, (double)rtp->rtcp->reported_jitter/65536., rtp->txcount, rtp->rtcp->reported_lost, rtp->rtcp->rtt);
02172    
02173    return rtp->rtcp->quality;
02174 }
02175 
02176 void ast_rtp_destroy(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02177 {
02178    if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them) || rtcpstats) {
02179       /*Print some info on the call here */
02180       ast_verbose("  RTP-stats\n");
02181       ast_verbose("* Our Receiver:\n");
02182       ast_verbose("  SSRC:     %u\n", rtp->themssrc);
02183       ast_verbose("  Received packets: %u\n", rtp->rxcount);
02184       ast_verbose("  Lost packets:   %u\n", rtp->rtcp->expected_prior - rtp->rtcp->received_prior);
02185       ast_verbose("  Jitter:      %.4f\n", rtp->rxjitter);
02186       ast_verbose("  Transit:     %.4f\n", rtp->rxtransit);
02187       ast_verbose("  RR-count:    %u\n", rtp->rtcp->rr_count);
02188       ast_verbose("* Our Sender:\n");
02189       ast_verbose("  SSRC:     %u\n", rtp->ssrc);
02190       ast_verbose("  Sent packets:   %u\n", rtp->txcount);
02191       ast_verbose("  Lost packets:   %u\n", rtp->rtcp->reported_lost);
02192       ast_verbose("  Jitter:      %u\n", rtp->rtcp->reported_jitter);
02193       ast_verbose("  SR-count:    %u\n", rtp->rtcp->sr_count);
02194       ast_verbose("  RTT:      %f\n", rtp->rtcp->rtt);
02195    }
02196 
02197    if (rtp->smoother)
02198       ast_smoother_free(rtp->smoother);
02199    if (rtp->ioid)
02200       ast_io_remove(rtp->io, rtp->ioid);
02201    if (rtp->s > -1)
02202       close(rtp->s);
02203    if (rtp->rtcp) {
02204       if (rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0)
