02205          ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02206       close(rtp->rtcp->s);
02207       free(rtp->rtcp);
02208       rtp->rtcp=NULL;
02209    }
02210 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE
02211    ast_mutex_destroy(&rtp->bridge_lock);
02212 #endif
02213    free(rtp);
02214 }
02215 
02216 static unsigned int calc_txstamp(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct timeval *delivery)
02217 {
02218    struct timeval t;
02219    long ms;
02220    if (ast_tvzero(rtp->txcore)) {
02221       rtp->txcore = ast_tvnow();
02222       /* Round to 20ms for nice, pretty timestamps */
02223       rtp->txcore.tv_usec -= rtp->txcore.tv_usec % 20000;
02224    }
02225    /* Use previous txcore if available */
02226    t = (delivery && !ast_tvzero(*delivery)) ? *delivery : ast_tvnow();
02227    ms = ast_tvdiff_ms(t, rtp->txcore);
02228    if (ms < 0)
02229       ms = 0;
02230    /* Use what we just got for next time */
02231    rtp->txcore = t;
02232    return (unsigned int) ms;
02233 }
02234 
02235 /*! \brief Send begin frames for DTMF */
02236 int ast_rtp_senddigit_begin(struct ast_rtp *rtp, char digit)
02237 {
02238    unsigned int *rtpheader;
02239    int hdrlen = 12, res = 0, i = 0, payload = 0;
02240    char data[256];
02241 
02242    if ((digit <= '9') && (digit >= '0'))
02243       digit -= '0';
02244    else if (digit == '*')
02245       digit = 10;
02246    else if (digit == '#')
02247       digit = 11;
02248    else if ((digit >= 'A') && (digit <= 'D'))
02249       digit = digit - 'A' + 12;
02250    else if ((digit >= 'a') && (digit <= 'd'))
02251       digit = digit - 'a' + 12;
02252    else {
02253       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Don't know how to represent '%c'\n", digit);
02254       return 0;
02255    }
02256 
02257    /* If we have no peer, return immediately */ 
02258    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr || !rtp->them.sin_port)
02259       return 0;
02260 
02261    payload = ast_rtp_lookup_code(rtp, 0, AST_RTP_DTMF);
02262 
02263    rtp->dtmfmute = ast_tvadd(ast_tvnow(), ast_tv(0, 500000));
02264    rtp->send_duration = 160;
02265    
02266    /* Get a pointer to the header */
02267    rtpheader = (unsigned int *)data;
02268    rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 23) | (payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02269    rtpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->lastdigitts);
02270    rtpheader[2] = htonl(rtp->ssrc); 
02271 
02272    for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
02273       rtpheader[3] = htonl((digit << 24) | (0xa << 16) | (rtp->send_duration));
02274       res = sendto(rtp->s, (void *) rtpheader, hdrlen + 4, 0, (struct sockaddr *) &rtp->them, sizeof(rtp->them));
02275       if (res < 0) 
02276          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTP Transmission error to %s:%u: %s\n",
02277             ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02278             ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02279       if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them))
02280          ast_verbose("Sent RTP DTMF packet to %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u)\n",
02281                 ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02282                 ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), payload, rtp->seqno, rtp->lastdigitts, res - hdrlen);
02283       /* Increment sequence number */
02284       rtp->seqno++;
02285       /* Increment duration */
02286       rtp->send_duration += 160;
02287       /* Clear marker bit and set seqno */
02288       rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02289    }
02290 
02291    /* Since we received a begin, we can safely store the digit and disable any compensation */
02292    rtp->sending_digit = 1;
02293    rtp->send_digit = digit;
02294    rtp->send_payload = payload;
02295 
02296    return 0;
02297 }
02298 
02299 /*! \brief Send continuation frame for DTMF */
02300 static int ast_rtp_senddigit_continuation(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02301 {
02302    unsigned int *rtpheader;
02303    int hdrlen = 12, res = 0;
02304    char data[256];
02305 
02306    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr || !rtp->them.sin_port)
02307       return 0;
02308 
02309    /* Setup packet to send */
02310    rtpheader = (unsigned int *)data;
02311         rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 23) | (rtp->send_payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02312         rtpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->lastdigitts);
02313         rtpheader[2] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);
02314         rtpheader[3] = htonl((rtp->send_digit << 24) | (0xa << 16) | (rtp->send_duration));
02315    rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (rtp->send_payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02316    
02317    /* Transmit */
02318    res = sendto(rtp->s, (void *) rtpheader, hdrlen + 4, 0, (struct sockaddr *) &rtp->them, sizeof(rtp->them));
02319    if (res < 0)
02320       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTP Transmission error to %s:%d: %s\n",
02321          ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02322          ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02323    if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them))
02324       ast_verbose("Sent RTP DTMF packet to %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u)\n",
02325              ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02326              ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), rtp->send_payload, rtp->seqno, rtp->lastdigitts, res - hdrlen);
02327 
02328    /* Increment sequence number */
02329    rtp->seqno++;
02330    /* Increment duration */
02331    rtp->send_duration += 160;
02332 
02333    return 0;
02334 }
02335 
02336 /*! \brief Send end packets for DTMF */
02337 int ast_rtp_senddigit_end(struct ast_rtp *rtp, char digit)
02338 {
02339    unsigned int *rtpheader;
02340    int hdrlen = 12, res = 0, i = 0;
02341    char data[256];
02342    
02343    /* If no address, then bail out */
02344    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr || !rtp->them.sin_port)
02345       return 0;
02346    
02347    if ((digit <= '9') && (digit >= '0'))
02348       digit -= '0';
02349    else if (digit == '*')
02350       digit = 10;
02351    else if (digit == '#')
02352       digit = 11;
02353    else if ((digit >= 'A') && (digit <= 'D'))
02354       digit = digit - 'A' + 12;
02355    else if ((digit >= 'a') && (digit <= 'd'))
02356       digit = digit - 'a' + 12;
02357    else {
02358       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Don't know how to represent '%c'\n", digit);
02359       return 0;
02360    }
02361 
02362    rtp->dtmfmute = ast_tvadd(ast_tvnow(), ast_tv(0, 500000));
02363 
02364    rtpheader = (unsigned int *)data;
02365    rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 23) | (rtp->send_payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02366    rtpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->lastdigitts);
02367    rtpheader[2] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);
02368    rtpheader[3] = htonl((digit << 24) | (0xa << 16) | (rtp->send_duration));
02369    /* Set end bit */
02370    rtpheader[3] |= htonl((1 << 23));
02371    rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (rtp->send_payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno));
02372    /* Send 3 termination packets */
02373    for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
02374       res = sendto(rtp->s, (void *) rtpheader, hdrlen + 4, 0, (struct sockaddr *) &rtp->them, sizeof(rtp->them));
02375       if (res < 0)
02376          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTP Transmission error to %s:%d: %s\n",
02377             ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02378             ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02379       if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them))
02380          ast_verbose("Sent RTP DTMF packet to %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u)\n",
02381                 ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr),
02382                 ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), rtp->send_payload, rtp->seqno, rtp->lastdigitts, res - hdrlen);
02383    }
02384    rtp->sending_digit = 0;
02385    rtp->send_digit = 0;
02386    /* Increment lastdigitts */
02387    rtp->lastdigitts += 960;
02388    rtp->seqno++;
02389 
02390    return res;
02391 }
02392 
02393 /*! \brief Public function: Send an H.261 fast update request, some devices need this rather than SIP XML */
02394 int ast_rtcp_send_h261fur(void *data)
02395 {
02396    struct ast_rtp *rtp = data;
02397    int res;
02398 
02399    rtp->rtcp->sendfur = 1;
02400    res = ast_rtcp_write(data);
02401    
02402    return res;
02403 }
02404 
02405 /*! \brief Send RTCP sender's report */
02406 static int ast_rtcp_write_sr(void *data)
02407 {
02408    struct ast_rtp *rtp = data;
02409    int res;
02410    int len = 0;
02411    struct timeval now;
02412    unsigned int now_lsw;
02413    unsigned int now_msw;
02414    unsigned int *rtcpheader;
02415    unsigned int lost;
02416    unsigned int extended;
02417    unsigned int expected;
02418    unsigned int expected_interval;
02419    unsigned int received_interval;
02420    int lost_interval;
02421    int fraction;
02422    struct timeval dlsr;
02423    char bdata[512];
02424 
02425    /* Commented condition is always not NULL if rtp->rtcp is not NULL */
02426    if (!rtp || !rtp->rtcp/* || (&rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr == 0)*/)
02427       return 0;
02428    
02429    if (!rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr) {  /* This'll stop rtcp for this rtp session */
02430       ast_verbose("RTCP SR transmission error, rtcp halted\n");
02431       if (rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0)
02432          ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02433       rtp->rtcp->schedid = -1;
02434       return 0;
02435    }
02436 
02437    gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
02438    timeval2ntp(now, &now_msw, &now_lsw); /* fill thses ones in from utils.c*/
02439    rtcpheader = (unsigned int *)bdata;
02440    rtcpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);               /* Our SSRC */
02441    rtcpheader[2] = htonl(now_msw);                 /* now, MSW. gettimeofday() + SEC_BETWEEN_1900_AND_1970*/
02442    rtcpheader[3] = htonl(now_lsw);                 /* now, LSW */
02443    rtcpheader[4] = htonl(rtp->lastts);             /* FIXME shouldn't be that, it should be now */
02444    rtcpheader[5] = htonl(rtp->txcount);            /* No. packets sent */
02445    rtcpheader[6] = htonl(rtp->txoctetcount);       /* No. bytes sent */
02446    len += 28;
02447    
02448    extended = rtp->cycles + rtp->lastrxseqno;
02449    expected = extended - rtp->seedrxseqno + 1;
02450    if (rtp->rxcount > expected) 
02451       expected += rtp->rxcount - expected;
02452    lost = expected - rtp->rxcount;
02453    expected_interval = expected - rtp->rtcp->expected_prior;
02454    rtp->rtcp->expected_prior = expected;
02455    received_interval = rtp->rxcount - rtp->rtcp->received_prior;
02456    rtp->rtcp->received_prior = rtp->rxcount;
02457    lost_interval = expected_interval - received_interval;
02458    if (expected_interval == 0 || lost_interval <= 0)
02459       fraction = 0;
02460    else
02461       fraction = (lost_interval << 8) / expected_interval;
02462    timersub(&now, &rtp->rtcp->rxlsr, &dlsr);
02463    rtcpheader[7] = htonl(rtp->themssrc);
02464    rtcpheader[8] = htonl(((fraction & 0xff) << 24) | (lost & 0xffffff));
02465    rtcpheader[9] = htonl((rtp->cycles) | ((rtp->lastrxseqno & 0xffff)));
02466    rtcpheader[10] = htonl((unsigned int)(rtp->rxjitter * 65536.));
02467    rtcpheader[11] = htonl(rtp->rtcp->themrxlsr);
02468    rtcpheader[12] = htonl((((dlsr.tv_sec * 1000) + (dlsr.tv_usec / 1000)) * 65536) / 1000);
02469    len += 24;
02470    
02471    rtcpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_SR << 16) | ((len/4)-1));
02472 
02473    if (rtp->rtcp->sendfur) {
02474       rtcpheader[13] = htonl((2 << 30) | (0 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_FUR << 16) | 1);
02475       rtcpheader[14] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);               /* Our SSRC */
02476       len += 8;
02477       rtp->rtcp->sendfur = 0;
02478    }
02479    
02480    /* Insert SDES here. Probably should make SDES text equal to mimetypes[code].type (not subtype 'cos */ 
02481    /* it can change mid call, and SDES can't) */
02482    rtcpheader[len/4]     = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_SDES << 16) | 2);
02483    rtcpheader[(len/4)+1] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);               /* Our SSRC */
02484    rtcpheader[(len/4)+2] = htonl(0x01 << 24);                    /* Empty for the moment */
02485    len += 12;
02486    
02487    res = sendto(rtp->rtcp->s, (unsigned int *)rtcpheader, len, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->rtcp->them, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them));
02488    if (res < 0) {
02489       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTCP SR transmission error to %s:%d, rtcp halted %s\n",ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02490       if (rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0)
02491          ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02492       rtp->rtcp->schedid = -1;
02493       return 0;
02494    }
02495    
02496    /* FIXME Don't need to get a new one */
02497    gettimeofday(&rtp->rtcp->txlsr, NULL);
02498    rtp->rtcp->sr_count++;
02499 
02500    rtp->rtcp->lastsrtxcount = rtp->txcount;  
02501    
02502    if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->rtcp->them)) {
02503       ast_verbose("* Sent RTCP SR to %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port));
02504       ast_verbose("  Our SSRC: %u\n", rtp->ssrc);
02505       ast_verbose("  Sent(NTP): %u.%010u\n", (unsigned int)now.tv_sec, (unsigned int)now.tv_usec*4096);
02506       ast_verbose("  Sent(RTP): %u\n", rtp->lastts);
02507       ast_verbose("  Sent packets: %u\n", rtp->txcount);
02508       ast_verbose("  Sent octets: %u\n", rtp->txoctetcount);
02509       ast_verbose("  Report block:\n");
02510       ast_verbose("  Fraction lost: %u\n", fraction);
02511       ast_verbose("  Cumulative loss: %u\n", lost);
02512       ast_verbose("  IA jitter: %.4f\n", rtp->rxjitter);
02513       ast_verbose("  Their last SR: %u\n", rtp->rtcp->themrxlsr);
02514       ast_verbose("  DLSR: %4.4f (sec)\n\n", (double)(ntohl(rtcpheader[12])/65536.0));
02515    }
02516    return res;
02517 }
02518 
02519 /*! \brief Send RTCP recipient's report */
02520 static int ast_rtcp_write_rr(void *data)
02521 {
02522    struct ast_rtp *rtp = data;
02523    int res;
02524    int len = 32;
02525    unsigned int lost;
02526    unsigned int extended;
02527    unsigned int expected;
02528    unsigned int expected_interval;
02529    unsigned int received_interval;
02530    int lost_interval;
02531    struct timeval now;
02532    unsigned int *rtcpheader;
02533    char bdata[1024];
02534    struct timeval dlsr;
02535    int fraction;
02536 
02537    if (!rtp || !rtp->rtcp || (&rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr == 0))
02538       return 0;
02539      
02540    if (!rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr.s_addr) {
02541       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTCP RR transmission error, rtcp halted\n");
02542       if (rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0)
02543          ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02544       rtp->rtcp->schedid = -1;
02545       return 0;
02546    }
02547 
02548    extended = rtp->cycles + rtp->lastrxseqno;
02549    expected = extended - rtp->seedrxseqno + 1;
02550    lost = expected - rtp->rxcount;
02551    expected_interval = expected - rtp->rtcp->expected_prior;
02552    rtp->rtcp->expected_prior = expected;
02553    received_interval = rtp->rxcount - rtp->rtcp->received_prior;
02554    rtp->rtcp->received_prior = rtp->rxcount;
02555    lost_interval = expected_interval - received_interval;
02556    if (expected_interval == 0 || lost_interval <= 0)
02557       fraction = 0;
02558    else
02559       fraction = (lost_interval << 8) / expected_interval;
02560    gettimeofday(&now, NULL);
02561    timersub(&now, &rtp->rtcp->rxlsr, &dlsr);
02562    rtcpheader = (unsigned int *)bdata;
02563    rtcpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_RR << 16) | ((len/4)-1));
02564    rtcpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);
02565    rtcpheader[2] = htonl(rtp->themssrc);
02566    rtcpheader[3] = htonl(((fraction & 0xff) << 24) | (lost & 0xffffff));
02567    rtcpheader[4] = htonl((rtp->cycles) | ((rtp->lastrxseqno & 0xffff)));
02568    rtcpheader[5] = htonl((unsigned int)(rtp->rxjitter * 65536.));
02569    rtcpheader[6] = htonl(rtp->rtcp->themrxlsr);
02570    rtcpheader[7] = htonl((((dlsr.tv_sec * 1000) + (dlsr.tv_usec / 1000)) * 65536) / 1000);
02571 
02572    if (rtp->rtcp->sendfur) {
02573       rtcpheader[8] = htonl((2 << 30) | (0 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_FUR << 16) | 1); /* Header from page 36 in RFC 3550 */
02574       rtcpheader[9] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);               /* Our SSRC */
02575       len += 8;
02576       rtp->rtcp->sendfur = 0;
02577    }
02578 
02579    /*! \note Insert SDES here. Probably should make SDES text equal to mimetypes[code].type (not subtype 'cos 
02580    it can change mid call, and SDES can't) */
02581    rtcpheader[len/4]     = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 24) | (RTCP_PT_SDES << 16) | 2);
02582    rtcpheader[(len/4)+1] = htonl(rtp->ssrc);               /* Our SSRC */
02583    rtcpheader[(len/4)+2] = htonl(0x01 << 24);              /* Empty for the moment */
02584    len += 12;
02585    
02586    res = sendto(rtp->rtcp->s, (unsigned int *)rtcpheader, len, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->rtcp->them, sizeof(rtp->rtcp->them));
02587 
02588    if (res < 0) {
02589       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTCP RR transmission error, rtcp halted: %s\n",strerror(errno));
02590       /* Remove the scheduler */
02591       if (rtp->rtcp->schedid > 0)
02592          ast_sched_del(rtp->sched, rtp->rtcp->schedid);
02593       rtp->rtcp->schedid = -1;
02594       return 0;
02595    }
02596 
02597    rtp->rtcp->rr_count++;
02598 
02599    if (rtcp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->rtcp->them)) {
02600       ast_verbose("\n* Sending RTCP RR to %s:%d\n"
02601          "  Our SSRC: %u\nTheir SSRC: %u\niFraction lost: %d\nCumulative loss: %u\n" 
02602          "  IA jitter: %.4f\n" 
02603          "  Their last SR: %u\n" 
02604          "  DLSR: %4.4f (sec)\n\n",
02605          ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_addr),
02606          ntohs(rtp->rtcp->them.sin_port),
02607          rtp->ssrc, rtp->themssrc, fraction, lost,
02608          rtp->rxjitter,
02609          rtp->rtcp->themrxlsr,
02610          (double)(ntohl(rtcpheader[7])/65536.0));
02611    }
02612 
02613    return res;
02614 }
02615 
02616 /*! \brief Write and RTCP packet to the far end
02617  * \note Decide if we are going to send an SR (with Reception Block) or RR 
02618  * RR is sent if we have not sent any rtp packets in the previous interval */
02619 static int ast_rtcp_write(void *data)
02620 {
02621    struct ast_rtp *rtp = data;
02622    int res;
02623    
02624    if (rtp->txcount > rtp->rtcp->lastsrtxcount)
02625       res = ast_rtcp_write_sr(data);
02626    else
02627       res = ast_rtcp_write_rr(data);
02628    
02629    return res;
02630 }
02631 
02632 /*! \brief generate comfort noice (CNG) */
02633 int ast_rtp_sendcng(struct ast_rtp *rtp, int level)
02634 {
02635    unsigned int *rtpheader;
02636    int hdrlen = 12;
02637    int res;
02638    int payload;
02639    char data[256];
02640    level = 127 - (level & 0x7f);
02641    payload = ast_rtp_lookup_code(rtp, 0, AST_RTP_CN);
02642 
02643    /* If we have no peer, return immediately */ 
02644    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)
02645       return 0;
02646 
02647    rtp->dtmfmute = ast_tvadd(ast_tvnow(), ast_tv(0, 500000));
02648 
02649    /* Get a pointer to the header */
02650    rtpheader = (unsigned int *)data;
02651    rtpheader[0] = htonl((2 << 30) | (1 << 23) | (payload << 16) | (rtp->seqno++));
02652    rtpheader[1] = htonl(rtp->lastts);
02653    rtpheader[2] = htonl(rtp->ssrc); 
02654    data[12] = level;
02655    if (rtp->them.sin_port && rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr) {
02656       res = sendto(rtp->s, (void *)rtpheader, hdrlen + 1, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->them, sizeof(rtp->them));
02657       if (res <0) 
02658          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "RTP Comfort Noise Transmission error to %s:%d: %s\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02659       if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them))
02660          ast_verbose("Sent Comfort Noise RTP packet to %s:%u (type %d, seq %u, ts %u, len %d)\n"
02661                , ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), payload, rtp->seqno, rtp->lastts,res - hdrlen);         
02662          
02663    }
02664    return 0;
02665 }
02666 
02667 /*! \brief Write RTP packet with audio or video media frames into UDP packet */
02668 static int ast_rtp_raw_write(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct ast_frame *f, int codec)
02669 {
02670    unsigned char *rtpheader;
02671    int hdrlen = 12;
02672    int res;
02673    unsigned int ms;
02674    int pred;
02675    int mark = 0;
02676 
02677    ms = calc_txstamp(rtp, &f->delivery);
02678    /* Default prediction */
02679    if (f->subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_AUDIO) {
02680       pred = rtp->lastts + f->samples;
02681 
02682       /* Re-calculate last TS */
02683       rtp->lastts = rtp->lastts + ms * 8;
02684       if (ast_tvzero(f->delivery)) {
02685          /* If this isn't an absolute delivery time, Check if it is close to our prediction, 
02686             and if so, go with our prediction */
02687          if (abs(rtp->lastts - pred) < MAX_TIMESTAMP_SKEW)
02688             rtp->lastts = pred;
02689          else {
02690             if (option_debug > 2)
02691                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Difference is %d, ms is %d\n", abs(rtp->lastts - pred), ms);
02692             mark = 1;
02693          }
02694       }
02695    } else if(f->subclass < AST_FORMAT_MAX_VIDEO) {
02696       mark = f->subclass & 0x1;
02697       pred = rtp->lastovidtimestamp + f->samples;
02698       /* Re-calculate last TS */
02699       rtp->lastts = rtp->lastts + ms * 90;
02700       /* If it's close to our prediction, go for it */
02701       if (ast_tvzero(f->delivery)) {
02702          if (abs(rtp->lastts - pred) < 7200) {
02703             rtp->lastts = pred;
02704             rtp->lastovidtimestamp += f->samples;
02705          } else {
02706             if (option_debug > 2)
02707                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Difference is %d, ms is %d (%d), pred/ts/samples %d/%d/%d\n", abs(rtp->lastts - pred), ms, ms * 90, rtp->lastts, pred, f->samples);
02708             rtp->lastovidtimestamp = rtp->lastts;
02709          }
02710       }
02711    } else {
02712       pred = rtp->lastotexttimestamp + f->samples;
02713       /* Re-calculate last TS */
02714       rtp->lastts = rtp->lastts + ms * 90;
02715       /* If it's close to our prediction, go for it */
02716       if (ast_tvzero(f->delivery)) {
02717          if (abs(rtp->lastts - pred) < 7200) {
02718             rtp->lastts = pred;
02719             rtp->lastotexttimestamp += f->samples;
02720          } else {
02721             if (option_debug > 2)
02722                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Difference is %d, ms is %d (%d), pred/ts/samples %d/%d/%d\n", abs(rtp->lastts - pred), ms, ms * 90, rtp->lastts, pred, f->samples);
02723             rtp->lastotexttimestamp = rtp->lastts;
02724          }
02725       }
02726    }
02727    /* If the timestamp for non-digit packets has moved beyond the timestamp
02728       for digits, update the digit timestamp.
02729    */
02730    if (rtp->lastts > rtp->lastdigitts)
02731       rtp->lastdigitts = rtp->lastts;
02732 
02733    if (f->has_timing_info)
02734       rtp->lastts = f->ts * 8;
02735 
02736    /* Get a pointer to the header */
02737    rtpheader = (unsigned char *)(f->data - hdrlen);
02738 
02739    put_unaligned_uint32(rtpheader, htonl((2 << 30) | (codec << 16) | (rtp->seqno) | (mark << 23)));
02740    put_unaligned_uint32(rtpheader + 4, htonl(rtp->lastts));
02741    put_unaligned_uint32(rtpheader + 8, htonl(rtp->ssrc)); 
02742 
02743    if (rtp->them.sin_port && rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr) {
02744       res = sendto(rtp->s, (void *)rtpheader, f->datalen + hdrlen, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&rtp->them, sizeof(rtp->them));
02745       if (res <0) {
02746          if (!rtp->nat || (rtp->nat && (ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE) == FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE))) {
02747             if (option_debug)
02748                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTP Transmission error of packet %d to %s:%d: %s\n", rtp->seqno, ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), strerror(errno));
02749          } else if (((ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE) == FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE) || rtpdebug) && !ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE_NOWARN)) {
02750             /* Only give this error message once if we are not RTP debugging */
02751             if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
02752                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "RTP NAT: Can't write RTP to private address %s:%d, waiting for other end to send audio...\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port));
02753             ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_INACTIVE_NOWARN);
02754          }
02755       } else {
02756          rtp->txcount++;
02757          rtp->txoctetcount +=(res - hdrlen);
02758          
02759          if (rtp->rtcp && rtp->rtcp->schedid < 1) 
02760              rtp->rtcp->schedid = ast_sched_add(rtp->sched, ast_rtcp_calc_interval(rtp), ast_rtcp_write, rtp);
02761       }
02762             
02763       if (rtp_debug_test_addr(&rtp->them))
02764          ast_verbose("Sent RTP packet to      %s:%u (type %-2.2d, seq %-6.6u, ts %-6.6u, len %-6.6u)\n",
02765                ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port), codec, rtp->seqno, rtp->lastts,res - hdrlen);
02766    }
02767 
02768    rtp->seqno++;
02769 
02770    return 0;
02771 }
02772 
02773 int ast_rtp_codec_setpref(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct ast_codec_pref *prefs)
02774 {
02775    int x;
02776    for (x = 0; x < 32; x++) {  /* Ugly way */
02777       rtp->pref.order[x] = prefs->order[x];
02778       rtp->pref.framing[x] = prefs->framing[x];
02779    }
02780    if (rtp->smoother)
02781       ast_smoother_free(rtp->smoother);
02782    rtp->smoother = NULL;
02783    return 0;
02784 }
02785 
02786 struct ast_codec_pref *ast_rtp_codec_getpref(struct ast_rtp *rtp)
02787 {
02788    return &rtp->pref;
02789 }
02790 
02791 int ast_rtp_codec_getformat(int pt)
02792 {
02793    if (pt < 0 || pt > MAX_RTP_PT)
02794       return 0; /* bogus payload type */
02795 
02796    if (static_RTP_PT[pt].isAstFormat)
02797       return static_RTP_PT[pt].code;
02798    else
02799       return 0;
02800 }
02801 
02802 int ast_rtp_write(struct ast_rtp *rtp, struct ast_frame *_f)
02803 {
02804    struct ast_frame *f;
02805    int codec;
02806    int hdrlen = 12;
02807    int subclass;
02808    
02809 
02810    /* If we have no peer, return immediately */ 
02811    if (!rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr)
02812       return 0;
02813 
02814    /* If there is no data length, return immediately */
02815    if (!_f->datalen) 
02816       return 0;
02817    
02818    /* Make sure we have enough space for RTP header */
02819    if ((_f->frametype != AST_FRAME_VOICE) && (_f->frametype != AST_FRAME_VIDEO) && (_f->frametype != AST_FRAME_TEXT)) {
02820       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "RTP can only send voice, video and text\n");
02821       return -1;
02822    }
02823 
02824    /* The bottom bit of a video subclass contains the marker bit */
02825    subclass = _f->subclass;
02826    if (_f->frametype == AST_FRAME_VIDEO)
02827       subclass &= ~0x1;
02828 
02829    codec = ast_rtp_lookup_code(rtp, 1, subclass);
02830    if (codec < 0) {
02831       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Don't know how to send format %s packets with RTP\n", ast_getformatname(_f->subclass));
02832       return -1;
02833    }
02834 
02835    if (rtp->lasttxformat != subclass) {
02836       /* New format, reset the smoother */
02837       if (option_debug)
02838          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Ooh, format changed from %s to %s\n", ast_getformatname(rtp->lasttxformat), ast_getformatname(subclass));
02839       rtp->lasttxformat = subclass;
02840       if (rtp->smoother)
02841          ast_smoother_free(rtp->smoother);
02842       rtp->smoother = NULL;
02843    }
02844 
02845    if (!rtp->smoother) {
02846       struct ast_format_list fmt = ast_codec_pref_getsize(&rtp->pref, subclass);
02847       if (fmt.inc_ms) { /* if codec parameters is set / avoid division by zero */
02848          if (!(rtp->smoother = ast_smoother_new((fmt.cur_ms * fmt.fr_len) / fmt.inc_ms))) {
02849             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create smoother: format: %d ms: %d len: %d\n", subclass, fmt.cur_ms, ((fmt.cur_ms * fmt.fr_len) / fmt.inc_ms));
02850             return -1;
02851          }
02852          if (fmt.flags)
02853             ast_smoother_set_flags(rtp->smoother, fmt.flags);
02854          if (option_debug)
02855             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Created smoother: format: %d ms: %d len: %d\n", subclass, fmt.cur_ms, ((fmt.cur_ms * fmt.fr_len) / fmt.inc_ms));
02856       }
02857    }
02858    if (rtp->smoother) {
02859       if (ast_smoother_test_flag(rtp->smoother, AST_SMOOTHER_FLAG_BE)) {
02860          ast_smoother_feed_be(rtp->smoother, _f);
02861       } else {
02862          ast_smoother_feed(rtp->smoother, _f);
02863       }
02864 
02865       while ((f = ast_smoother_read(rtp->smoother)))
02866          ast_rtp_raw_write(rtp, f, codec);
02867    } else {
02868            /* Don't buffer outgoing frames; send them one-per-packet: */
02869       if (_f->offset < hdrlen) 
02870          f = ast_frdup(_f);   /*! \bug XXX this might never be free'd. Why do we do this? */
02871       else
02872          f = _f;
02873       ast_rtp_raw_write(rtp, f, codec);
02874       if (f != _f)
02875          ast_frfree(f);
02876    }
02877       
02878    return 0;
02879 }
02880 
02881 /*! \brief Unregister interface to channel driver */
02882 void ast_rtp_proto_unregister(struct ast_rtp_protocol *proto)
02883 {
02884    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&protos);
02885    AST_RWLIST_REMOVE(&protos, proto, list);
02886    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&protos);
02887 }
02888 
02889 /*! \brief Register interface to channel driver */
02890 int ast_rtp_proto_register(struct ast_rtp_protocol *proto)
02891 {
02892    struct ast_rtp_protocol *cur;
02893 
02894    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&protos);
02895    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&protos, cur, list) { 
02896       if (!strcmp(cur->type, proto->type)) {
02897          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Tried to register same protocol '%s' twice\n", cur->type);
02898          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&protos);
02899          return -1;
02900       }
02901    }
02902    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&protos, proto, list);
02903    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&protos);
02904    
02905    return 0;
02906 }
02907 
02908 /*! \brief Bridge loop for true native bridge (reinvite) */
02909 static enum ast_bridge_result bridge_native_loop(struct ast_channel *c0, struct ast_channel *c1, struct ast_rtp *p0, struct ast_rtp *p1, struct ast_rtp *vp0, struct ast_rtp *vp1, struct ast_rtp *tp0, struct ast_rtp *tp1, struct ast_rtp_protocol *pr0, struct ast_rtp_protocol *pr1, int codec0, int codec1, int timeoutms, int flags, struct ast_frame **fo, struct ast_channel **rc, void *pvt0, void *pvt1)
02910 {
02911    struct ast_frame *fr = NULL;
02912    struct ast_channel *who = NULL, *other = NULL, *cs[3] = {NULL, };
02913    int oldcodec0 = codec0, oldcodec1 = codec1;
02914    struct sockaddr_in ac1 = {0,}, vac1 = {0,}, tac1 = {0,}, ac0 = {0,}, vac0 = {0,}, tac0 = {0,};
02915    struct sockaddr_in t1 = {0,}, vt1 = {0,}, tt1 = {0,}, t0 = {0,}, vt0 = {0,}, tt0 = {0,};
02916    
02917    /* Set it up so audio goes directly between the two endpoints */
02918 
02919    /* Test the first channel */
02920    if (!(pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, p1, vp1, tp1, codec1, ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))) {
02921       ast_rtp_get_peer(p1, &ac1);
02922       if (vp1)
02923          ast_rtp_get_peer(vp1, &vac1);
02924       if (tp1)
02925          ast_rtp_get_peer(tp1, &tac1);
02926    } else
02927       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to talk to '%s'\n", c0->name, c1->name);
02928    
02929    /* Test the second channel */
02930    if (!(pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, p0, vp0, tp0, codec0, ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))) {
02931       ast_rtp_get_peer(p0, &ac0);
02932       if (vp0)
02933          ast_rtp_get_peer(vp0, &vac0);
02934       if (tp0)
02935          ast_rtp_get_peer(tp0, &tac0);
02936    } else
02937       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to talk to '%s'\n", c1->name, c0->name);
02938 
02939    /* Now we can unlock and move into our loop */
02940    ast_channel_unlock(c0);
02941    ast_channel_unlock(c1);
02942 
02943    /* Throw our channels into the structure and enter the loop */
02944    cs[0] = c0;
02945    cs[1] = c1;
02946    cs[2] = NULL;
02947    for (;;) {
02948       /* Check if anything changed */
02949       if ((c0->tech_pvt != pvt0) ||
02950           (c1->tech_pvt != pvt1) ||
02951           (c0->masq || c0->masqr || c1->masq || c1->masqr)) {
02952          if (option_debug)
02953             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, something is weird, backing out\n");
02954          if (c0->tech_pvt == pvt0)
02955             if (pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0))
02956                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to break RTP bridge\n", c0->name);
02957          if (c1->tech_pvt == pvt1)
02958             if (pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0))
02959                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to break RTP bridge\n", c1->name);
02960          return AST_BRIDGE_RETRY;
02961       }
02962 
02963       /* Check if they have changed their address */
02964       ast_rtp_get_peer(p1, &t1);
02965       if (vp1)
02966          ast_rtp_get_peer(vp1, &vt1);
02967       if (tp1)
02968          ast_rtp_get_peer(tp1, &tt1);
02969       if (pr1->get_codec)
02970          codec1 = pr1->get_codec(c1);
02971       ast_rtp_get_peer(p0, &t0);
02972       if (vp0)
02973          ast_rtp_get_peer(vp0, &vt0);
02974       if (tp0)
02975          ast_rtp_get_peer(tp0, &tt0);
02976       if (pr0->get_codec)
02977          codec0 = pr0->get_codec(c0);
02978       if ((inaddrcmp(&t1, &ac1)) ||
02979           (vp1 && inaddrcmp(&vt1, &vac1)) ||
02980           (tp1 && inaddrcmp(&tt1, &tac1)) ||
02981           (codec1 != oldcodec1)) {
02982          if (option_debug > 1) {
02983             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' changed end address to %s:%d (format %d)\n",
02984                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(t1.sin_addr), ntohs(t1.sin_port), codec1);
02985             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' changed end vaddress to %s:%d (format %d)\n",
02986                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(vt1.sin_addr), ntohs(vt1.sin_port), codec1);
02987             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' changed end taddress to %s:%d (format %d)\n",
02988                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(tt1.sin_addr), ntohs(tt1.sin_port), codec1);
02989             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' was %s:%d/(format %d)\n",
02990                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(ac1.sin_addr), ntohs(ac1.sin_port), oldcodec1);
02991             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' was %s:%d/(format %d)\n",
02992                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(vac1.sin_addr), ntohs(vac1.sin_port), oldcodec1);
02993             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' was %s:%d/(format %d)\n",
02994                c1->name, ast_inet_ntoa(tac1.sin_addr), ntohs(tac1.sin_port), oldcodec1);
02995          }
02996          if (pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, t1.sin_addr.s_addr ? p1 : NULL, vt1.sin_addr.s_addr ? vp1 : NULL, tt1.sin_addr.s_addr ? tp1 : NULL, codec1, ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))
02997             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to update to '%s'\n", c0->name, c1->name);
02998          memcpy(&ac1, &t1, sizeof(ac1));
02999          memcpy(&vac1, &vt1, sizeof(vac1));
03000          memcpy(&tac1, &tt1, sizeof(tac1));
03001          oldcodec1 = codec1;
03002       }
03003       if ((inaddrcmp(&t0, &ac0)) ||
03004           (vp0 && inaddrcmp(&vt0, &vac0)) ||
03005           (tp0 && inaddrcmp(&tt0, &tac0))) {
03006          if (option_debug > 1) {
03007             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' changed end address to %s:%d (format %d)\n",
03008                c0->name, ast_inet_ntoa(t0.sin_addr), ntohs(t0.sin_port), codec0);
03009             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, '%s' was %s:%d/(format %d)\n",
03010                c0->name, ast_inet_ntoa(ac0.sin_addr), ntohs(ac0.sin_port), oldcodec0);
03011          }
03012          if (pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, t0.sin_addr.s_addr ? p0 : NULL, vt0.sin_addr.s_addr ? vp0 : NULL, tt0.sin_addr.s_addr ? tp0 : NULL, codec0, ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE)))
03013             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to update to '%s'\n", c1->name, c0->name);
03014          memcpy(&ac0, &t0, sizeof(ac0));
03015          memcpy(&vac0, &vt0, sizeof(vac0));
03016          memcpy(&tac0, &tt0, sizeof(tac0));
03017          oldcodec0 = codec0;
03018       }
03019 
03020       /* Wait for frame to come in on the channels */
03021       if (!(who = ast_waitfor_n(cs, 2, &timeoutms))) {
03022          if (!timeoutms)
03023             return AST_BRIDGE_RETRY;
03024          if (option_debug)
03025             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Ooh, empty read...\n");
03026          if (ast_check_hangup(c0) || ast_check_hangup(c1))
03027             break;
03028          continue;
03029       }
03030       fr = ast_read(who);
03031       other = (who == c0) ? c1 : c0;
03032       if (!fr || ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF) &&
03033              (((who == c0) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_0)) ||
03034               ((who == c1) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_1))))) {
03035          /* Break out of bridge */
03036          *fo = fr;
03037          *rc = who;
03038          if (option_debug)
03039             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, got a %s\n", fr ? "digit" : "hangup");
03040          if (c0->tech_pvt == pvt0)
03041             if (pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0))
03042                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to break RTP bridge\n", c0->name);
03043          if (c1->tech_pvt == pvt1)
03044             if (pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0))
03045                ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' failed to break RTP bridge\n", c1->name);
03046          return AST_BRIDGE_COMPLETE;
03047       } else if ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_CONTROL) && !(flags & AST_BRIDGE_IGNORE_SIGS)) {
03048          if ((fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_HOLD) ||
03049              (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_UNHOLD) ||
03050              (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_VIDUPDATE)) {
03051             if (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_HOLD) {
03052                /* If we someone went on hold we want the other side to reinvite back to us */
03053                if (who == c0)
03054                   pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0);
03055                else
03056                   pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0, 0);
03057             } else if (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_UNHOLD) {
03058                /* If they went off hold they should go back to being direct */
03059                if (who == c0)
03060                   pr1->set_rtp_peer(c1, p0, vp0, tp0, codec0, ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE));
03061                else
03062                   pr0->set_rtp_peer(c0, p1, vp1, tp1, codec1, ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE));
03063             }
03064             ast_indicate_data(other, fr->subclass, fr->data, fr->datalen);
03065             ast_frfree(fr);
03066          } else {
03067             *fo = fr;
03068             *rc = who;
03069             if (option_debug)
03070                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Got a FRAME_CONTROL (%d) frame on channel %s\n", fr->subclass, who->name);
03071             return AST_BRIDGE_COMPLETE;
03072          }
03073       } else {
03074          if ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF_BEGIN) ||
03075              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF) ||
03076              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_VOICE) ||
03077              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_VIDEO) ||
03078              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_IMAGE) ||
03079              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_HTML) ||
03080              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_MODEM) ||
03081              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_TEXT)) {
03082             ast_write(other, fr);
03083          }
03084          ast_frfree(fr);
03085       }
03086       /* Swap priority */
03087       cs[2] = cs[0];
03088       cs[0] = cs[1];
03089       cs[1] = cs[2];
03090    }
03091 
03092    return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03093 }
03094 
03095 /*! \brief P2P RTP Callback */
03096 #ifdef P2P_INTENSE
03097 static int p2p_rtp_callback(int *id, int fd, short events, void *cbdata)
03098 {
03099    int res = 0, hdrlen = 12;
03100    struct sockaddr_in sin;
03101    socklen_t len;
03102    unsigned int *header;
03103    struct ast_rtp *rtp = cbdata, *bridged = NULL;
03104 
03105    if (!rtp)
03106       return 1;
03107 
03108    len = sizeof(sin);
03109    if ((res = recvfrom(fd, rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET, sizeof(rtp->rawdata) - AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET, 0, (struct sockaddr *)&sin, &len)) < 0)
03110       return 1;
03111 
03112    header = (unsigned int *)(rtp->rawdata + AST_FRIENDLY_OFFSET);
03113    
03114    /* If NAT support is turned on, then see if we need to change their address */
03115    if ((rtp->nat) && 
03116        ((rtp->them.sin_addr.s_addr != sin.sin_addr.s_addr) ||
03117         (rtp->them.sin_port != sin.sin_port))) {
03118       rtp->them = sin;
03119       rtp->rxseqno = 0;
03120       ast_set_flag(rtp, FLAG_NAT_ACTIVE);
03121       if (option_debug || rtpdebug)
03122          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "P2P RTP NAT: Got audio from other end. Now sending to address %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtp->them.sin_addr), ntohs(rtp->them.sin_port));
03123    }
03124 
03125    /* Write directly out to other RTP stream if bridged */
03126    if ((bridged = ast_rtp_get_bridged(rtp)))
03127       bridge_p2p_rtp_write(rtp, bridged, header, res, hdrlen);
03128    
03129    return 1;
03130 }
03131 
03132 /*! \brief Helper function to switch a channel and RTP stream into callback mode */
03133 static int p2p_callback_enable(struct ast_channel *chan, struct ast_rtp *rtp, int **iod)
03134 {
03135    /* If we need DTMF, are looking for STUN, or we have no IO structure then we can't do direct callback */
03136    if (ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) || ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_HAS_STUN) || !rtp->io)
03137       return 0;
03138 
03139    /* If the RTP structure is already in callback mode, remove it temporarily */
03140    if (rtp->ioid) {
03141       ast_io_remove(rtp->io, rtp->ioid);
03142       rtp->ioid = NULL;
03143    }
03144 
03145    /* Steal the file descriptors from the channel */
03146    chan->fds[0] = -1;
03147 
03148    /* Now, fire up callback mode */
03149    iod[0] = ast_io_add(rtp->io, ast_rtp_fd(rtp), p2p_rtp_callback, AST_IO_IN, rtp);
03150 
03151    return 1;
03152 }
03153 #else
03154 static int p2p_callback_enable(struct ast_channel *chan, struct ast_rtp *rtp, int **iod)
03155 {
03156    return 0;
03157 }
03158 #endif
03159 
03160 /*! \brief Helper function to switch a channel and RTP stream out of callback mode */
03161 static int p2p_callback_disable(struct ast_channel *chan, struct ast_rtp *rtp, int **iod)
03162 {
03163    ast_channel_lock(chan);
03164 
03165    /* Remove the callback from the IO context */
03166    ast_io_remove(rtp->io, iod[0]);
03167 
03168    /* Restore file descriptors */
03169    chan->fds[0] = ast_rtp_fd(rtp);
03170    ast_channel_unlock(chan);
03171 
03172    /* Restore callback mode if previously used */
03173    if (ast_test_flag(rtp, FLAG_CALLBACK_MODE))
03174       rtp->ioid = ast_io_add(rtp->io, ast_rtp_fd(rtp), rtpread, AST_IO_IN, rtp);
03175 
03176    return 0;
03177 }
03178 
03179 /*! \brief Helper function that sets what an RTP structure is bridged to */
03180 static void p2p_set_bridge(struct ast_rtp *rtp0, struct ast_rtp *rtp1)
03181 {
03182    rtp_bridge_lock(rtp0);
03183         rtp0->bridged = rtp1;
03184    rtp_bridge_unlock(rtp0);
03185 
03186         return;
03187 }
03188 
03189 /*! \brief Bridge loop for partial native bridge (packet2packet) 
03190 
03191    In p2p mode, Asterisk is a very basic RTP proxy, just forwarding whatever
03192    rtp/rtcp we get in to the channel. 
03193    \note this currently only works for Audio
03194 */
03195 static enum ast_bridge_result bridge_p2p_loop(struct ast_channel *c0, struct ast_channel *c1, struct ast_rtp *p0, struct ast_rtp *p1, int timeoutms, int flags, struct ast_frame **fo, struct ast_channel **rc, void *pvt0, void *pvt1)
03196 {
03197    struct ast_frame *fr = NULL;
03198    struct ast_channel *who = NULL, *other = NULL, *cs[3] = {NULL, };
03199    int *p0_iod[2] = {NULL, NULL}, *p1_iod[2] = {NULL, NULL};
03200    int p0_callback = 0, p1_callback = 0;
03201    enum ast_bridge_result res = AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03202 
03203    /* Okay, setup each RTP structure to do P2P forwarding */
03204    ast_clear_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
03205    p2p_set_bridge(p0, p1);
03206    ast_clear_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
03207    p2p_set_bridge(p1, p0);
03208 
03209    /* Activate callback modes if possible */
03210    p0_callback = p2p_callback_enable(c0, p0, &p0_iod[0]);
03211    p1_callback = p2p_callback_enable(c1, p1, &p1_iod[0]);
03212 
03213    /* Now let go of the channel locks and be on our way */
03214    ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03215    ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03216 
03217    /* Go into a loop forwarding frames until we don't need to anymore */
03218    cs[0] = c0;
03219    cs[1] = c1;
03220    cs[2] = NULL;
03221    for (;;) {
03222       /* Check if anything changed */
03223       if ((c0->tech_pvt != pvt0) ||
03224           (c1->tech_pvt != pvt1) ||
03225           (c0->masq || c0->masqr || c1->masq || c1->masqr)) {
03226          if (option_debug > 2)
03227             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "p2p-rtp-bridge: Oooh, something is weird, backing out\n");
03228          /* If a masquerade needs to happen we have to try to read in a frame so that it actually happens. Without this we risk being called again and going into a loop */
03229          if ((c0->masq || c0->masqr) && (fr = ast_read(c0)))
03230             ast_frfree(fr);
03231          if ((c1->masq || c1->masqr) && (fr = ast_read(c1)))
03232             ast_frfree(fr);
03233          res = AST_BRIDGE_RETRY;
03234          break;
03235       }
03236       /* Wait on a channel to feed us a frame */
03237       if (!(who = ast_waitfor_n(cs, 2, &timeoutms))) {
03238          if (!timeoutms) {
03239             res = AST_BRIDGE_RETRY;
03240             break;
03241          }
03242          if (option_debug > 2)
03243             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "p2p-rtp-bridge: Ooh, empty read...\n");
03244          if (ast_check_hangup(c0) || ast_check_hangup(c1))
03245             break;
03246          continue;
03247       }
03248       /* Read in frame from channel */
03249       fr = ast_read(who);
03250       other = (who == c0) ? c1 : c0;
03251       /* Depending on the frame we may need to break out of our bridge */
03252       if (!fr || ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF) &&
03253              ((who == c0) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_0)) |
03254              ((who == c1) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_1)))) {
03255          /* Record received frame and who */
03256          *fo = fr;
03257          *rc = who;
03258          if (option_debug > 2)
03259             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "p2p-rtp-bridge: Ooh, got a %s\n", fr ? "digit" : "hangup");
03260          res = AST_BRIDGE_COMPLETE;
03261          break;
03262       } else if ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_CONTROL) && !(flags & AST_BRIDGE_IGNORE_SIGS)) {
03263          if ((fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_HOLD) ||
03264              (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_UNHOLD) ||
03265              (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_VIDUPDATE)) {
03266             /* If we are going on hold, then break callback mode and P2P bridging */
03267             if (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_HOLD) {
03268                if (p0_callback)
03269                   p0_callback = p2p_callback_disable(c0, p0, &p0_iod[0]);
03270                if (p1_callback)
03271                   p1_callback = p2p_callback_disable(c1, p1, &p1_iod[0]);
03272                p2p_set_bridge(p0, NULL);
03273                p2p_set_bridge(p1, NULL);
03274             } else if (fr->subclass == AST_CONTROL_UNHOLD) {
03275                /* If we are off hold, then go back to callback mode and P2P bridging */
03276                ast_clear_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
03277                p2p_set_bridge(p0, p1);
03278                ast_clear_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_SENT_MARK);
03279                p2p_set_bridge(p1, p0);
03280                p0_callback = p2p_callback_enable(c0, p0, &p0_iod[0]);
03281                p1_callback = p2p_callback_enable(c1, p1, &p1_iod[0]);
03282             }
03283             ast_indicate_data(other, fr->subclass, fr->data, fr->datalen);
03284             ast_frfree(fr);
03285          } else {
03286             *fo = fr;
03287             *rc = who;
03288             if (option_debug > 2)
03289                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "p2p-rtp-bridge: Got a FRAME_CONTROL (%d) frame on channel %s\n", fr->subclass, who->name);
03290             res = AST_BRIDGE_COMPLETE;
03291             break;
03292          }
03293       } else {
03294          if ((fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF_BEGIN) ||
03295              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_DTMF) ||
03296              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_VOICE) ||
03297              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_VIDEO) ||
03298              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_IMAGE) ||
03299              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_HTML) ||
03300              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_MODEM) ||
03301              (fr->frametype == AST_FRAME_TEXT)) {
03302             ast_write(other, fr);
03303          }
03304 
03305          ast_frfree(fr);
03306       }
03307       /* Swap priority */
03308       cs[2] = cs[0];
03309       cs[0] = cs[1];
03310       cs[1] = cs[2];
03311    }
03312 
03313    /* If we are totally avoiding the core, then restore our link to it */
03314    if (p0_callback)
03315       p0_callback = p2p_callback_disable(c0, p0, &p0_iod[0]);
03316    if (p1_callback)
03317       p1_callback = p2p_callback_disable(c1, p1, &p1_iod[0]);
03318 
03319    /* Break out of the direct bridge */
03320    p2p_set_bridge(p0, NULL);
03321    p2p_set_bridge(p1, NULL);
03322 
03323    return res;
03324 }
03325 
03326 /*! \page AstRTPbridge The Asterisk RTP bridge 
03327    The RTP bridge is called from the channel drivers that are using the RTP
03328    subsystem in Asterisk - like SIP, H.323 and Jingle/Google Talk.
03329 
03330    This bridge aims to offload the Asterisk server by setting up
03331    the media stream directly between the endpoints, keeping the
03332    signalling in Asterisk.
03333 
03334    It checks with the channel driver, using a callback function, if
03335    there are possibilities for a remote bridge.
03336 
03337    If this fails, the bridge hands off to the core bridge. Reasons
03338    can be NAT support needed, DTMF features in audio needed by
03339    the PBX for transfers or spying/monitoring on channels.
03340 
03341    If transcoding is needed - we can't do a remote bridge.
03342    If only NAT support is needed, we're using Asterisk in
03343    RTP proxy mode with the p2p RTP bridge, basically
03344    forwarding incoming audio packets to the outbound
03345    stream on a network level.
03346 
03347    References:
03348    - ast_rtp_bridge()
03349    - ast_channel_early_bridge()
03350    - ast_channel_bridge()
03351    - rtp.c
03352    - rtp.h
03353 */
03354 /*! \brief Bridge calls. If possible and allowed, initiate
03355    re-invite so the peers exchange media directly outside 
03356    of Asterisk. 
03357 */
03358 enum ast_bridge_result ast_rtp_bridge(struct ast_channel *c0, struct ast_channel *c1, int flags, struct ast_frame **fo, struct ast_channel **rc, int timeoutms)
03359 {
03360    struct ast_rtp *p0 = NULL, *p1 = NULL;    /* Audio RTP Channels */
03361    struct ast_rtp *vp0 = NULL, *vp1 = NULL;  /* Video RTP channels */
03362    struct ast_rtp *tp0 = NULL, *tp1 = NULL;  /* Text RTP channels */
03363    struct ast_rtp_protocol *pr0 = NULL, *pr1 = NULL;
03364    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_p0_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_p0_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03365    enum ast_rtp_get_result audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, video_p1_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED, text_p1_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03366    enum ast_bridge_result res = AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03367    int codec0 = 0, codec1 = 0;
03368    void *pvt0 = NULL, *pvt1 = NULL;
03369 
03370    /* Lock channels */
03371    ast_channel_lock(c0);
03372    while (ast_channel_trylock(c1)) {
03373       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03374       usleep(1);
03375       ast_channel_lock(c0);
03376    }
03377 
03378    /* Find channel driver interfaces */
03379    if (!(pr0 = get_proto(c0))) {
03380       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't find native functions for channel '%s'\n", c0->name);
03381       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03382       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03383       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03384    }
03385    if (!(pr1 = get_proto(c1))) {
03386       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't find native functions for channel '%s'\n", c1->name);
03387       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03388       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03389       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED;
03390    }
03391 
03392    /* Get channel specific interface structures */
03393    pvt0 = c0->tech_pvt;
03394    pvt1 = c1->tech_pvt;
03395 
03396    /* Get audio and video interface (if native bridge is possible) */
03397    audio_p0_res = pr0->get_rtp_info(c0, &p0);
03398    video_p0_res = pr0->get_vrtp_info ? pr0->get_vrtp_info(c0, &vp0) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03399    text_p0_res = pr0->get_trtp_info ? pr0->get_trtp_info(c0, &vp0) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03400    audio_p1_res = pr1->get_rtp_info(c1, &p1);
03401    video_p1_res = pr1->get_vrtp_info ? pr1->get_vrtp_info(c1, &vp1) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03402    text_p1_res = pr1->get_trtp_info ? pr1->get_trtp_info(c1, &vp1) : AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03403 
03404    /* If we are carrying video, and both sides are not reinviting... then fail the native bridge */
03405    if (video_p0_res != AST_RTP_GET_FAILED && (audio_p0_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || video_p0_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE))
03406       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03407    if (video_p1_res != AST_RTP_GET_FAILED && (audio_p1_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE || video_p1_res != AST_RTP_TRY_NATIVE))
03408       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_GET_FAILED;
03409 
03410    /* Check if a bridge is possible (partial/native) */
03411    if (audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_GET_FAILED || audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_GET_FAILED) {
03412       /* Somebody doesn't want to play... */
03413       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03414       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03415       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03416    }
03417 
03418    /* If we need to feed DTMF frames into the core then only do a partial native bridge */
03419    if (ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_0)) {
03420       ast_set_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF);
03421       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03422    }
03423 
03424    if (ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) && (flags & AST_BRIDGE_DTMF_CHANNEL_1)) {
03425       ast_set_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF);
03426       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03427    }
03428 
03429    /* If both sides are not using the same method of DTMF transmission 
03430     * (ie: one is RFC2833, other is INFO... then we can not do direct media. 
03431     * --------------------------------------------------
03432     * | DTMF Mode |  HAS_DTMF  |  Accepts Begin Frames |
03433     * |-----------|------------|-----------------------|
03434     * | Inband    | False      | True                  |
03435     * | RFC2833   | True       | True                  |
03436     * | SIP INFO  | False      | False                 |
03437     * --------------------------------------------------
03438     * However, if DTMF from both channels is being monitored by the core, then
03439     * we can still do packet-to-packet bridging, because passing through the 
03440     * core will handle DTMF mode translation.
03441     */
03442    if ( (ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_HAS_DTMF) != ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_HAS_DTMF)) ||
03443        (!c0->tech->send_digit_begin != !c1->tech->send_digit_begin)) {
03444       if (!ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) || !ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF)) {
03445          ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03446          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03447          return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03448       }
03449       audio_p0_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03450       audio_p1_res = AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL;
03451    }
03452 
03453    /* If the core will need to compensate and the P2P bridge will need to feed up DTMF frames then we can not reliably do so yet, so do not P2P bridge */
03454    if ((audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL && ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) && ast_test_flag(p0, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE)) ||
03455        (audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL && ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_P2P_NEED_DTMF) && ast_test_flag(p1, FLAG_DTMF_COMPENSATE))) {
03456       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03457       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03458       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03459    }
03460 
03461    /* Get codecs from both sides */
03462    codec0 = pr0->get_codec ? pr0->get_codec(c0) : 0;
03463    codec1 = pr1->get_codec ? pr1->get_codec(c1) : 0;
03464    if (codec0 && codec1 && !(codec0 & codec1)) {
03465       /* Hey, we can't do native bridging if both parties speak different codecs */
03466       if (option_debug > 2)
03467          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Channel codec0 = %d is not codec1 = %d, cannot native bridge in RTP.\n", codec0, codec1);
03468       ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03469       ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03470       return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03471    }
03472 
03473    /* If either side can only do a partial bridge, then don't try for a true native bridge */
03474    if (audio_p0_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL || audio_p1_res == AST_RTP_TRY_PARTIAL) {
03475       /* In order to do Packet2Packet bridging both sides must be in the same rawread/rawwrite */
03476       if (c0->rawreadformat != c1->rawwriteformat || c1->rawreadformat != c0->rawwriteformat) {
03477          if (option_debug)
03478             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Cannot packet2packet bridge - raw formats are incompatible\n");
03479          ast_channel_unlock(c0);
03480          ast_channel_unlock(c1);
03481          return AST_BRIDGE_FAILED_NOWARN;
03482       }
03483       if (option_verbose > 2)
03484          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Packet2Packet bridging %s and %s\n", c0->name, c1->name);
03485       res = bridge_p2p_loop(c0, c1, p0, p1, timeoutms, flags, fo, rc, pvt0, pvt1);
03486    } else {
03487       if (option_verbose > 2) 
03488          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Native bridging %s and %s\n", c0->name, c1->name);
03489       res = bridge_native_loop(c0, c1, p0, p1, vp0, vp1, tp0, tp1, pr0, pr1, codec0, codec1, timeoutms, flags, fo, rc, pvt0, pvt1);
03490    }
03491 
03492    return res;
03493 }
03494 
03495 static int rtp_do_debug_ip(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03496 {
03497    struct hostent *hp;
03498    struct ast_hostent ahp;
03499    int port = 0;
03500    char *p, *arg;
03501 
03502    if (argc != 4)
03503       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03504    arg = argv[3];
03505    p = strstr(arg, ":");
03506    if (p) {
03507       *p = '\0';
03508       p++;
03509       port = atoi(p);
03510    }
03511    hp = ast_gethostbyname(arg, &ahp);
03512    if (hp == NULL)
03513       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03514    rtpdebugaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03515    memcpy(&rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr, hp->h_addr, sizeof(rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr));
03516    rtpdebugaddr.sin_port = htons(port);
03517    if (port == 0)
03518       ast_cli(fd, "RTP Debugging Enabled for IP: %s\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr));
03519    else
03520       ast_cli(fd, "RTP Debugging Enabled for IP: %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtpdebugaddr.sin_addr), port);
03521    rtpdebug = 1;
03522    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03523 }
03524 
03525 static int rtcp_do_debug_ip(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03526 {
03527    struct hostent *hp;
03528    struct ast_hostent ahp;
03529    int port = 0;
03530    char *p, *arg;
03531    if (argc != 4)
03532       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03533 
03534    arg = argv[3];
03535    p = strstr(arg, ":");
03536    if (p) {
03537       *p = '\0';
03538       p++;
03539       port = atoi(p);
03540    }
03541    hp = ast_gethostbyname(arg, &ahp);
03542    if (hp == NULL)
03543       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03544    rtcpdebugaddr.sin_family = AF_INET;
03545    memcpy(&rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr, hp->h_addr, sizeof(rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr));
03546    rtcpdebugaddr.sin_port = htons(port);
03547    if (port == 0)
03548       ast_cli(fd, "RTCP Debugging Enabled for IP: %s\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr));
03549    else
03550       ast_cli(fd, "RTCP Debugging Enabled for IP: %s:%d\n", ast_inet_ntoa(rtcpdebugaddr.sin_addr), port);
03551    rtcpdebug = 1;
03552    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03553 }
03554 
03555 static int rtp_do_debug(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03556 {
03557    if (argc != 2) {
03558       if (argc != 4)
03559          return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03560       return rtp_do_debug_ip(fd, argc, argv);
03561    }
03562    rtpdebug = 1;
03563    memset(&rtpdebugaddr,0,sizeof(rtpdebugaddr));
03564    ast_cli(fd, "RTP Debugging Enabled\n");
03565    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03566 }
03567    
03568 static int rtcp_do_debug(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03569 {
03570    if (argc != 2) {
03571       if (argc != 4)
03572          return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03573       return rtcp_do_debug_ip(fd, argc, argv);
03574    }
03575    rtcpdebug = 1;
03576    memset(&rtcpdebugaddr,0,sizeof(rtcpdebugaddr));
03577    ast_cli(fd, "RTCP Debugging Enabled\n");
03578    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03579 }

03709 int ast_rtp_reload(void)
03710 {
03711    struct ast_config *cfg;
03712    const char *s;
03713 
03714    rtpstart = 5000;
03715    rtpend = 31000;
03716    dtmftimeout = DEFAULT_DTMF_TIMEOUT;
03717    cfg = ast_config_load("rtp.conf");
03718    if (cfg) {
03719       if ((s = ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "general", "rtpstart"))) {
03720          rtpstart = atoi(s);
03721          if (rtpstart < 1024)
03722             rtpstart = 1024;
03723          if (rtpstart > 65535)
03724             rtpstart = 65535;
03725       }
03726       if ((s = ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "general", "rtpend"))) {
03727          rtpend = atoi(s);
03728          if (rtpend < 1024)
03729             rtpend = 1024;
03730          if (rtpend > 65535)
03731             rtpend = 65535;
03732       }
03733       if ((s = ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "general", "rtcpinterval"))) {
03734          rtcpinterval = atoi(s);
03735          if (rtcpinterval == 0)
03736             rtcpinterval = 0; /* Just so we're clear... it's zero */
03737          if (rtcpinterval < RTCP_MIN_INTERVALMS)
03738             rtcpinterval = RTCP_MIN_INTERVALMS; /* This catches negative numbers too */
03739          if (rtcpinterval > RTCP_MAX_INTERVALMS)
03740             rtcpinterval = RTCP_MAX_INTERVALMS;
03741       }
03742       if ((s = ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "general", "rtpchecksums"))) {
03743 #ifdef SO_NO_CHECK
03744          if (ast_false(s))
03745             nochecksums = 1;
03746          else
03747             nochecksums = 0;
03748 #else
03749          if (ast_false(s))
03750             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Disabling RTP checksums is not supported on this operating system!\n");
03751 #endif
03752       }
03753       if ((s = ast_variable_retrieve(cfg, "general", "dtmftimeout"))) {
03754          dtmftimeout = atoi(s);
03755          if ((dtmftimeout < 0) || (dtmftimeout > 20000)) {
03756             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "DTMF timeout of '%d' outside range, using default of '%d' instead\n",
03757                dtmftimeout, DEFAULT_DTMF_TIMEOUT);
03758             dtmftimeout = DEFAULT_DTMF_TIMEOUT;
03759          };
03760       }
03761       ast_config_destroy(cfg);
03762    }
03763    if (rtpstart >= rtpend) {
03764       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unreasonable values for RTP start/end port in rtp.conf\n");
03765       rtpstart = 5000;
03766       rtpend = 31000;
03767    }
03768    if (option_verbose > 1)
03769       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "RTP Allocating from port range %d -> %d\n", rtpstart, rtpend);
03770    return 0;
03771 }
03772 
03773 /*! \brief Initialize the RTP system in Asterisk */
03774 void ast_rtp_init(void)
03775 {
03776    ast_cli_register_multiple(cli_rtp, sizeof(cli_rtp) / sizeof(struct ast_cli_entry));
03777    ast_rtp_reload();
03778 }
